Reviews.Author: Rosemarie
Reviews.Content: I got suckered in by being lazy and just looking at the 4 and 5 stars rather than reading and doing further research.  I did not read the bad reviews first, which I do quite often because it tells me more than those 4 or 5 stars and the reason why the place was rated poorly.   Anyhow, after coming home from a bad experience from this place and finally reading the bad reviews, we all had the same experience! VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! I am big on this. I think a place deserve 4-5 stars if they have a balance of both great customer service AND food. It can't be 4 or 5 stars just based off food or just based off customer service.    1.) The Nutella Honey Toast was the special in which we ordered - delicious. 2.) Blood Orange Tea - very good and went well with what we ordered. 3.) Your food being slammed on your table - WTF! My daughter asked me why she did that; I explained to her that she may just be tired because they were busy.  I gave her the benefit of the doubt.  4.) Coming up to our table and giving us an attitude and  telling us that they made a mistake on our order because they gave us too much tea (which I was a bit confused on because I ordered 2 and they gave us two pots but I couldn't confirm it because they did not give me a receipt to reference back into), then gave us the dirtiest look ever - UNBELIEVABLE!   To the Serenade Manager and/or Owner, I have never felt so unappreciated or bad about being a customer. If you and your staff doesn't fix your attitude AND the way you treat your customer, then I wouldn't be surprise if you close your doors.  Just an FYI, your customers are the reason you are in business, and so customer service should be your utmost priority!   Social Media is a powerful tool!  I will make sure to spread the word on your VERY POOR AND RUDE CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Reviews.Author: Jones
Reviews.Content: Really great place to kick it with your friends and to get a snack or some drinks. Only downside is that the music here is so loud that I think I'm losing hearing in my ears. Would come back.

Reviews.Author: Rodney
Reviews.Content: This place is nice and the ambience is soothing. The music soft and always feels like winter inside. The layout looks like the sparklings restaurant down the road. It had a nice Korean theme which i enjoy and the selection of desserts is amazing..the babinsoo is good. Also the staff is genuine and sincerely nice. I love it here.

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Meeting for a cup of joe...well tea  Pros- 1) Soy Chai Tea Latte Hot...Very good! Not overly spiced, pretty mild.  2) Outdoor seating available 3) Nice variety of music 4) Full electrical strip running along the window...everyone can plug in! 5) Decent price. In house cup was $5.50 6) Complimentary fruit-infused water  Cons- 1) Smoking is available at the outdoor tables so if you're a non- smoker, outside is not a great option for you.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Perfect espresso, smooth, full body strong aroma and good after taste! This place nice and good service! One of the best coffee shop in Las Vegas

Reviews.Author: Yuta
Reviews.Content: I went here after hearing from friends how good the coffee and desserts were. I must say that this place does not live up to my expectations.   First, they are displaying coffee beans from different regions of the world. I ask the barista if I could pick the type of coffee or espresso beans and if they had any single origin beans. They basically looked at me funny and told me they only have one type. So if they only have one type, why display beans from different regions? That just doesn't make sense.   Next, they advertise that they are a coffee and dessert place. They dessert menu is super limited with only a couple different types of waffles, honey bread/toast, some kind of lemon pie, and something that looked like a strawberry short cake.   I ordered the Espresso con Panna and it was way over extracted. My friend asked if they had any sugar free drinks and they said they don't add any sugar. Not the answer she was looking for.   The only reason I give this place 3 stars is because the Cookie Monster waffle was pretty good.   Anyways, they have no business trying to portray being a high-end coffee shop charging high-end prices.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of fun flavors of Honey Toast- Cookie Monster came with oreo cookies (truthfully, it looked like diabetes on a plate), a not sweet option, Plain, Maple honey toast with sliced almonds (we got this one and it was sort of like a cinnamon roll meets french toast. The texture and ratios of ingredients were on point. I highly recommend.).  A shot of espresso is $2.71. Non-coffee lattes are $4.50. So if you want a fun flavored latte, you pay way too much. We got the pistachio latte with a shot of espresso on the side so we could taste it in its original form- probably the best pistachio latte I will ever have. No latte art. No size options.   We also ordered the Green Tea Latte- still, no espresso. No latte art. No size option. I forgot to order espresso so when I went back (because lordy did I need it- obviously) and saw that it was about the price of their coffee drinks I decided to order a Raspberry Macchiato to meet my caffeine demands and further satisfy my desire to try something new. It was beautiful. The raspberry drizzle was in a chess pattern atop the foam. I wouldn't order it again because raspberry isn't my thing but I am glad I experienced it.   There are a lot of 2-top seating, a single 4-top table, and maybe 4 3-top tables outside with lightweight chairs. Not a place for a large group of ppl. We experienced both settings because it got really hot inside. I usually love a nice cozy coffee shop but this was just hot (and not decorated to be cozy- not couch or fluffy chairs). The workers looked busy so we didn't ask to change the temp but really did appreciate that they had outdoor seating all of a sudden.  The pastry display made me look away. It wasn't inviting and looked cluttered. They did have tons of macaroons and a couple other rich and/or dense desserts. No actual pastries but whatevs because: Honey Toast!  It was too hot, overpriced, offered no foam art for the price, and for a place that doesn't have a dish drop off, I had to declutter our table. The look of the place was really cute and I appreciated the style of the furniture and paintings on the windows.   Park behind the building on the street for close parking ;)

Reviews.Author: Priscilla
Reviews.Content: I love this place although I gave 4 stars because of the music being hit and miss. Some times it's jazz which is great and versatile for a coffee joint but when they are playing k-pop or Korean hiphop, it's pretty annoying... And I don't end up staying. When I do stay I order multiple refills because they have the best coffee in Vegas! Toffee latte, chai latte, and Spanish latte are my go to choices:) and their honey toast is great just a little over priced and you'll be done with your drink by the time it comes out, it takes a while to make the toast so ask them to make your drink when it's ready. Ambience is adorable ;)

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: First off, download the app: Epoxy so you can get an e-stamp card ;). If you come often enough, why not?  They've got desserts, tea, coffee, and stuff like that.  The place isn't exactly spacious so bring a friend or two but a group is ill-advised. Especially if you're just chilling and playing cards or something. Bring that to Fresh Cup or Icy Juicy or something.  Otherwise, it's a pretty chill place to be at with a few friends. They've also got outside seating so it'll be a bit more roomy once the weather gets warmer. The tea gets you free refills. My favorite is Fiji, hands down, and nothing else has really stood out to me.  Very Berry Waffle - I approve. Haven't tried the Maple Story or the toast but they're definitely up on my list soon enough.

Reviews.Author: Tifanie
Reviews.Content: A wonderful coffee shop right by my place!!! I came here yesterday at around 3pm, it was pretty dead, but I'm sure they get busy in the morning and later on at night. I love that they close at 2am. The atmosphere is great, it's such a cute coffee shop that reminds you of the ones in the streets of Korea.   Oh myyyyyyy, the pistachio latte is to die for! I personally love pistachio EVERYTHING and their pistachio latte just brings me to heaven! My friend had a plain espresso and it was darn strong and enough to keep anyone awake! I have yet to try their honest toast and other items on the menu.  Their service is awesome as well, there was only one worker. We sat outside but he was so sweet to bring the drinks out to us which he really didn't have to. This review is missing a star because I wish their prices were a bit lower. That might be the only reason that stops me from going there everyday. Nonetheless, go try it or you're missing out! You will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: One of the good late night places to hang out! :)  I love the ambience, drinks and pastries here. I always get the earl grey tea pot and honey toast!

Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: I was looking for gourmet iced coffee in Vegas one day. Then the name  Serenade  popped up and a song was playing in my head with a chorus... So I serenade my song, my love for you and I ll give you my heart and I ll serenade for you . Yup, I was drawn here by the words.   Once inside it felt like a L.A./Orange County Asian-Style coffee shop. Modern decors, college atmosphere, but most of all the coffee menu. Yea, it felt like home here in the desert.  We always like to start with unique choices, so my wife went with their Iced Mango Macchiato. We really liked it! it had that usual espresso taste with a hint of mango flavor. It wasn't overly sweet or rich in milk, but was it balanced, refreshing and it was a better pick than my Toffee Coffee Frappuccino. Speaking of my Toffee Coffee Frap. it wasn't too bad. The overall make was better than a typical Starbucks Frap. The blend was okay  I should've asked for extra blended  for much smoother ice, but the coffee taste was light followed by the Toffee  Heath Bar  like flavor to the tip of my tongue.  This joint is located outside the city and it will  Serenade for you .

Reviews.Author: Iza
Reviews.Content: I have finally come back after some time of not giving them all my money lol (because I used to be there at least 3 times a week) and I must say, customer service is still AMAZING! As well as their quality of teas, coffees, desserts, and juices.   One new thing I did see was they have a wide selection of macarons. Which is super cool if you don't want to go too far to get your macaron fix.   Serenade is still the hot spot to study in the area and wouldn't mind you being there for 4 hours. Also, being there for a long period of time really tempts you on buying more which I think is part of the reason they don't mind you staying. I know I always buy at least one more thing if I'm there for a long time.   Also, remember to tip! I know we're all broke college students (most of us) but if you're there taking up space and you only buy one thing at least give them a tip, its just the right thing to do, especially since their customer service has never changed since day one. I really respect them for that.

Reviews.Author: McKenzie
Reviews.Content: I visited this cozy little place yesterday. We are in Las Vegas for a week and my friend recommended Serenade. I ordered hot green tea in beautiful pot with a candle and iced white mocha for my husband. They use really nice coffee machine and tastes were good. A super cute miss who served us was really sweet and kind. She took very nice care of us. Nice weather sitting outside, nice music, and nice talking with my beloved one made a perfect night!

Reviews.Author: Honey
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing, kind staff, great macaroons and a must try pistachio latte. Love it here!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: My dreams have come true...  My kidneys might hate me, but wow, my dreams sure have come true! I was just talking about how our area needs a super posh coffeehouse.  What a beautiful new place and I'm very proud to have this in my neighborhood.  I must confess I'm in love with Sambalatte but Serenade? It also gets 4.5 starts but since it's soo close to my house it's get rounded up to 5.  I love black coffee. I love strong, plain, black coffee. So I usually just get whatever is fresh and everything that I have tried here has been wonderful! The next time I'm there I'm going to ask for a hand pour.  My husband got to try this place on Saturday when we stopped before we headed out to Spring Mountain Park and now he is hooked. He got the famous pistachio latte iced with soymilk. I really love this drink also BUT...it's really just too sweet for me.  I like my coffee hot and black. Summertime I like my coffee iced and black.  I'm easy to please as long as it's not bitter. My fav is Sumatra.   I usually only come here morning or midmorning but I love the fact they have late night hours. I try not to drink coffee past 3pm but I love that they are there at night if I need them. Looks like a cool spot to hangout but I always get my cup in a rush and to go.  Super duper sweet customer service and I tip accordingly. Top notch classy. I really love the guys that work there. I'm surprised I don't know their names yet...but I'm sure I will soon :)  Oh and their outdoor patio has heaters if needed for this winter :)

Reviews.Author: Sunny
Reviews.Content: Serenade.. The first shave ice cream place in Vegas.. [SERVICE] The service was okay..they're were able to give us the food on time and it didn't take that long for the food to be prepared. [FOOD]  * Coffee Bingsoo: It's really good, but a little bit sweet due to the coffee.. * Green Tea Bingsoo [Not Pictured]: I recommend the green tea..not to sweet but it's perfect. *Macrons: Pretty sweet. Also if you buy 5 macrons, the 6th macron is free..(People, take advantage of this..)  [THOUGHTS] To be honest, this place is pretty neat, and has really creative and cute interior inside the cafe. The desserts are really good.

Reviews.Author: Madee
Reviews.Content: Been here twice already and still can't get over the great ambience, skillfully made drinks, and honey toast! Yes it's on the pricey side but the I can tell they don't skimp out on low quality products. The quality is great as far as tea and coffee go.  The service is very friendly and sympathetic. I wasn't terribly pleased with my iced mango macchiato the first time around, but they were more than willing to take it back and make me another.  Got to try some raspberry macarons and a lemon cream cake that were well made and not overwhelmingly sweet. If you're a returning customer, I definitely recommend that you try those when you get a chance. But if you're only going to try this place once, you can't go wrong with the honey toast and a Fiji tea/Spanish latte/pistachio latte (for the drinks, it just depends on what you're craving!) Otherwise, definitely come back and try them all if you can.

Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: Stopped by on a Saturday early afternoon, 2ish. Several customer, otherwise not busy or crowded. Clean, industrial warm feel.   I ordered some macarons and an iced chai tea latte to go. The chai tea was made from powder, it was pretty rich, sweet, and creamy. But it wasn't mixed too well with the ice because it didn't really have that chilled taste, just cold. The macarons were a bit on the small side. I tasted their coconut flavor. The filling had a nice coconut flavor creamy and a thick whipped consistency. The cookie itself was soft but didn't have that chewiness I expect in a macaron. So while soft, it was also a bit dry and delicate. I really wanted to try their honey brick toast but unfortunately I was in a little hurry and didn't have a chance to this time.   At this time, the Music was playing at a decent volume, and the place was overall nice and quiet.. A decent place to study or work.  Open late!

Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: New favorite espresso spot very well designed takes you out of vegas and makes you feel like you're on vacation. Espresso machiatto goes down smooth.

Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: Love the atmosphere of this place! The owner was really nice and I loved their very berry waffle! Their hot green tea was amazing too!

Reviews.Author: Autumn
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  It's right by my house and the coffee and food is awesome.  Great service and a good place to study or hang out

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Not a bad spot.  Very cozy and the coffee is good and the desserts are better.  I noticed every time I go there is only one worker so service gets to be a bit slooooow.  I would recommend this spot but with just a little bit better customer service this place could be five stars.

Reviews.Author: Seonjo
Reviews.Content: Pistachio latte is amazing!! Kyle is very nice. Great atmosphere and must try their honey toast!

Reviews.Author: Trent
Reviews.Content: Still love their Kona Mocha and Mint Chocolate frappe but found out they don't actually put any espresso in which essentially means it's a milk shake. Adding a shot is ok but waters it down a lot.  Also kind of annoyed I showed up at about noon on a Saturday and everything was closed.

Reviews.Author: Kylie
Reviews.Content: Sooo yummy!! Open til 2 am! The irish cream cake was to die for! We tried the toffee coffee frap & white chocolate symphony and they were both amazing! Highly recommend for a late night coffee spot!

Reviews.Author: Larraine
Reviews.Content: I honestly love this place. I'm a big fan of hidden cafes with sweetness on the side. You must try the Belgian waffles & their shave ice. I recommend you share with someone if you don't eat a lot. Other than dessert, their tea is fantastic! I would recommend trying the Fiji tea. It is absolutely wonderful. Come try!

Reviews.Author: Angelique
Reviews.Content: First time here and I really enjoy this place. The atmosphere is really nice and they have a good playlist going. It has a really nice clean vibe and I really liked how big the tables were because I was able to spread out all of my school materials and have room for my coffee and honey bread.        I tried the Spanish latte and the plain honey bread (basically this giant piece of toast with a soft center topped with vanilla ice cream). Both were pretty good but I probably won't get the honey bread again. It's really sweet so anyone who loves sweet things should definitely check it out. They have free water available so that helped settle my tummy with all the sugar moving around.       There's quite a lot of seating options and they have free wifi, just ask for the password. There's a lot of tables located by wall plugs which is great when you're here studying for long periods of time. Overall I gave this place 4 stars because even though I wasn't a fan of how sweet the honey bread was, everything else was pretty okay.

Reviews.Author: April Rose
Reviews.Content: Came here to study, as recommended by some friends. It was a little hard to find because it was hidden in the corner of a plaza. It's a cute little coffee shop where you walk right up to the counter, order your drink, find yourself a table and they bring your order to you. Ordered a pistachio latte per Yelpers and it did not let down!! If I lived in Vegas this would definitely be the study spot!

Reviews.Author: Nicolas
Reviews.Content: If you want to study or read a book while drinking authentic drinks from Korea it's the best place for you. I come often here to relax after a long day at work to drink my favorite drink green tea latte.

Reviews.Author: Desiree
Reviews.Content: Love this place. The desserts are good and their drinks are great as well. I like their cakes, and especially the coffee drinks. The pistachio latte is awesome too-it's just not a coffee drink.

Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: VISUAL AESTHETIC: 5/5 This cafe centers around the more relaxed Korean styled cafes that are located in Seoul. The large window panes have pictures that look loosely as if they were painted or something based off white line drawings. The inside is very modern, with wood paneling along the walls and floor to match with the round tables. It gives a sort of  French  vibe that matches the ambient lighting that is presented during the evening time. There is a small round platform I can assume is a stage, but does have a table on it. It has a set of studio lights displayed over.   The large bags of coffee beans with the signs sticking out are very cute, but slightly hide the table and door that is behind it. The exit leads to a patio with a couple set of  tables outdoors that match with a set inside. For nice weather and those that like to smoke, this is a nice plus.   DRINK: 4/5 I ordered a hot pot of green tea, which was served over a candle that had a heart shaped stove-like platform. The cups that were included were double layered plastic, to keep the heat, but I was not a big fan of the material they were made out of. Overall, the tea was delicious, served well, but nothing out of the ordinary.  SERVICE: 4/5 The cashier was very nice and spoke clearly while enunciating when I had questions. However, I did not appreciate that when a friend and I had stepped outside to speak, I heard some of the employees murmuring in Korean  what are they still doing here?    Serenade is open late, and we left about half an hour before the time of close so we would not burden their closing procedures or force them to stay longer than necessary. They were able to leave about ten minutes early since no one else was in the cafe, so I found their comments sort of rude.  OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 4.5/5 The music can be partially obnoxious when you are trying to study, if you are uncomfortable with noise. However, I found the environment was great to influence focus. The tea was good, again not anything above and beyond, but it was served hot and had a very good taste. I would certainly return to Serenade.

Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Decided to try a new place since sephoria is closed now and we got the honey toast, pistachio latte, and a couple of macaroons. Probably the best macaroons we've had here they are soft on the outside and not too strong on the inside. Best macaroons to date. The pistachio latte was really good had the authentic pistachio flavor but still the sweet taste too. The honey toast was simple and good but eat it sparing the pieces with honey on it because it's so thick the bottom portion ends up being pretty boring. Good but a little bit pricey for how simple the stuff is.

Reviews.Author: Crystalyn
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome neighborhood cafe!! the coffee and tea are both incredible. This is a good place to go if you are looking for real coffee and latte drinks!! The decorations throughout the coffee shop are unique and cozy. This is a great place for a coffee date or some intentional study time. The service is always friendly and respectful.

Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: Nice place to go for a cup of coffee with your girls.  I ordered the rasberry mocha and my friend ordered the pistachio latte.  Both which were good.  I wouldn't say it is the best like Illy coffee or Sambalatte, but its a cool place to grab unique drinks and it is close by.  My son had the ham and cheese panini with potato chip.  I have to say it was not very good but whatever I guess.  I come here for the drinks.

Reviews.Author: Peiwei
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here on and off for a while now. I tend to have mixed feelings about this place. Sometimes it gets way too crowded. Sometimes the drinks taste okay. Sometimes the service isn't too great. What I do like about here is that there is plenty of seating, comparing to many other cafes in town. There's both indoor and outdoor seating, and larger and smaller tables. Also wifi here works pretty well, which is why it does get busy, especially with most people on laptops. Drinks here are good, but honestly, nothing especially memorable. But then again I haven't tried everything on the menu. I will keep coming back every once in a while, but it's not my go-to coffee shop.

Reviews.Author: Alyssa
Reviews.Content: my favorite place! the shop is well decorated, plays gentle music, and staff is amazing! the honey bread & pistachio latte are the best I've had so far.

Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: I love the honey bread. It has a crunchy outer crust and soft chewy center with butter, honey, and ice cream. Pair it with zzz tea or pistachio latte. It's a great way to end my busy day. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Lainie
Reviews.Content: Eeeeh, not really my best tea experience. I ordered Green Tea. It was $8.00 for a pot. I was expecting stellar quality tea, this pot of tea did not deliver. I would compare The tea I was given to regular tea bag emptied from a tea bag into a strainer. The quality of the tools used were appreciated, but if the product doesn't shine it shows. The lounge also leaves something to be desired. It was not particularly comfortable or very inviting. The chairs were suited for a quick sit in the yard, not a long, leisurely rest with some tasty sips.  I drove about 30 minutes from the strip to visit this location based solely on Yelp reviews. What a waste of time. Thanks a bunch, Yelpers. NOT.

Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: Delicious drinks and even tastier food items on the menu, my gf an i's favorite is the honey bread, super crispy and still so soft in the middle, very subtle sweetness from the honey an ice cream. Great way to end a night especially since they are open till 2am

Reviews.Author: Fiona
Reviews.Content: SO IN LOVE With their chai latte!  I live in NYC so I'm never out of cafe options in the area, but this place does make the best chai latte I've ever had! Every time I leave Vegas I get bummed that I won't be able to get their chai latte for a while.  They do open a bit later than most other cafes which is kind of annoying when I really want my early chai latte fix early in the morning.

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: This place has a great ambiance, I loove the decor here!! It's great place to bring your laptop and do some work or just hang out and relax. They play good music (hip hop, my fave) and the staff is friendly and helpful. I never know what I want to order so they helped me find a good option...the strawberry-ade. YUM!! It has a lot of seeds but is fizzy and refreshing and tastes like a liquid strawberry. We also ordered and shared the Honeybread, which is a delicious brick of bread with ice cream in the middle, and honey drizzled over the top. Definitely big enough for 2+ people. The warm bread with the ice cream is such a delicious mix of textures and flavors!! Omg I will for sure be back!!

Reviews.Author: Sheri
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite coffee and drink shop because it opens till 2am and they have a variety of drinks. I have tried the Pistachio Latte and Raspberry Latte, which is both delicious! I usually come here if I need to study or write papers. The ambiance is relaxing and it's cute like a Korean coffee shop. It's also fun to go here to catch up with friends or on a coffee date.   The drinks are $4.50-5, which is decent for a cup. They also have some desserts, but I haven't tried it yet. This place always seem to be packed and sometimes it's tough to find a place to sit inside. However, there's outdoor seating, which I think it's nice during the spring when it's not too cold or not too hot.   I'll be back soon since it's close to my house so it's definitely convenient!

Reviews.Author: Ro
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Fantastic decor and top notch ambience. Delicious desserts and amazing drinks.

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Took some family from out of town to Serenade after our hotpot dinner. It's nice that they close so late so we were able to enjoy some late night sweets. None of us have ever been to a Korean cafe and not familiar with these types of Asian desserts. We ordered the famous honey toast, green tea shaved ice and a caramel machiatto. The desserts were $9 each which I thought was a bit steep until I saw them come out.  They were huge portions.   I've heard epic tales of the honey toast from Ichiza but this will be my first time having this dessert. It lived up to the hype-so fluffy on the inside, toasty & crispy on the outside and the honey added a wonderfully sweet and floral flavor. The toast was so large it could have used another small scoop of ice cream but other else no complaints!   The green tea shaved ice was an ordeal in itself to assemble and eat. I was wondering what was taking so long until I watched them make it with layer after layer of yummy goodness that complimented each other well. From red bean paste to corn flakes, it seemed like everything was in it and it nearly toppled over. There were 5 of us altogether that shared the desserts and we really enjoyed it. They were both light and we didn't leave with a tummy ache from overly sweetened and/or fattening desserts. Aside from the painfully slow service,  I would def come back.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Pistachio Latte!!!!  Props to Charity F. for the tip.  It really is the most delicious drink ever.  If you want your frenemies to love you then this will do it.  I've never had anything like it.  No really, I'm allergic to nuts, so I've stayed clear of any food that's associate with it.  Better safe than have any consequences.  Then came the other night my friend and i decided to meet here (closed at 2am; last call at ~1:30am) since the location was ideal between us.  Neither of us we're hungry, but just in case Serenade offer dessert bites such as Berries Waffles, Honey Toast, and other various cakes to pair with our cafe latte.  I convinced my friend to order the Hot (or cold) Pistachio Latte and also choose something for me as well since i don't really drink coffee, nor do I speak Starbucks.    We sat down at a table and our drinks arrived shortly after.  No saucer or napkins.  Just the cup.  The bare minimum.  I get up to grab some napkins only to return to my friend; elbows on the table, mug between her hands, and the biggest grin on her little face.  Super FOMO gahhh!! Now I'm really curious to see what's this is all about. So I man up, took a sip, and boy I was not expecting that. My brain could not register what was going on. Instead dropping dead on the floor, I was enchanted and lifted instead! Literally unimaginable.  The taste was not rich, bold, nor overly sweet.  It wasn't extremely hot either, yet my body felted warmth.  Another sip of the soft, creamy latte then smoothed out all my other sense.  Completely blissed out. There's nothing I would change about it.  Perfection.  This is the drink you want to share to your loved ones.  And by sharing I mean introducing because I'll be dam if some buttface want to get up on this.  Since then I came back twice within days.  Once with my sister and another with fellow Elite Yelper, Victoria Q. to partake this fine brew again.  Each one confirming that it does in fact taste like pistachio.  With no allergic reaction I still refused to try the real seed.  Don't want to push my luck because I need to live longer to spread this discovery. So for now I'll just have to take all my friends here individually to reassure me that what I'm tasting is really pistachio. Just to be sure. *wink*   *Almond Milk available*

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: There is a place open for late night desserts and coffee that's not on the Strip or in Chinatown. After dinner and a show, we wanted to get some coffee and talk without being in a crowded vicinity.    We came to this quaint Korean style coffee house.  Everything about it made me long for my favorite place in Korea. The textural differences on the walls, the cute cityscape drawings on the windows, the wicker chairs and metal tables were just a throwback. The coffee was delicious and strong. I saw the honey toast go out and it is a beast.  I am more excited to give the green tea bingsu a try though. At least I know where to go when I want to go and relax in comfort.

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: The drinks are expensive, the honey toast is alright (better at Ichiza or at Shokudo in Hawaii) and the green tea and pistachio latte are too sweet for my liking. Also, K-Pop is not the best mood music for any coffee joint. So all in all, cute aesthetic, great hours and points for having patio seating. But that's all.

Reviews.Author: Nicholas
Reviews.Content: Delicious, comfortable and super friendly baristas, another wonderful coffee shop to visit in Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: I love the honey toast!!! Drinks are good for the smaller menu!!! The vibe is good and relaxing. There isn't a crowd coming and going, so it's quieter. I just wish they opened earlier!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: My new favorite coffee shop! I was there on opening day and fell in love. This place is overall so chic and the atmosphere is perfect. I love the relaxed ambience the Korean music in the background creates.   On top of that, the employees are so nice! Great customer service.   All of their drinks and desserts are amazing, my favorite being the Serenade drink (red grape and apple), their Italian lemon cake (drizzled in sauce and topped with berries), the pistachio latte, honey bread and berry waffle. They offer a variety of teas which are also delicious.   Everything about this place is great! I'm here at least 3 times a week, and it is a perfect place to study, catch up with friends or simply hang out on your own. Personally I never like dining anywhere alone, but Serenade makes it comfortable enough to do so. Definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Came here to study/read. Recently found out from a friend that they brought back the hot tea with tea pots and tea cups. And sure enough, they did !  Ordered the green tea. simple green tea.   Service was great. They periodically came up to me, when my pot was near empty, asking if i wanted a refill of hot water.   Before i left, i brought the pot, cup, and holder back to them. This is one of the main reasons why i go here, is because of the tea pot :D   One thing i wonder though is if they'd let me get a pot of hot water and cup and let me use my own tea ..... ? since they dont have like various chinese teas.

Reviews.Author: Brinkley
Reviews.Content: Overall super cute place! The decor is super cute and I love the cozy vibe. I had the raspberry macchiato and my friend had the hot chocolate. Both were really good and I like the design they did on my drink. We also split a honey toast which was made to order so it was really fresh. Service was very friendly as well and they brought the drink to your table so you didn't have to stand and wait. I'll definitely be back! P.S: small suggestion, get some heat lamps for the outdoor area! There weren't any when I was here tonight.

Reviews.Author: Bree
Reviews.Content: This shop is adorable. Really lovely decor and ambiance, it's neither too quiet nor too loud. Great for studying on your own, having a group meeting or catching up with a friend.  Went in the middle of the day - not sure how much is related, there.  The staff is very nice and polite. I've only had a blended vanilla (with almond milk) which tasted like delicious sugar coffee. If you're missing a sweet tooth, stay away from the flavored beverages.  They've got a jug of lemon water for customers which I thought was nifty.  All around really great spot, good drinks and service at standard prices. Definitely recommend and will return.

Reviews.Author: Kassandra
Reviews.Content: Macaroons are super tasty! Recommend for people who love to chit chat, have sweets, and hang out or study here :) love love love this place!

Reviews.Author: Sunflowers
Reviews.Content: Honey toast s good but it s expensive !  I wish it could be $5 each. The view s nice and relaxing ! I love the music ! Very nice .

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Visited on 8/23/2014  Stopped here for a quick snack. The honey toast is insanely delicious. Toasted perfectly to a crisp, then drizzled with honey; this is a much have if you're on the south side of town. I also had the pistachio latte, which was amazing as well. Serenade is a small coffee shop with excellent food and drinks.

Reviews.Author: Young
Reviews.Content: Great drinks, open late, good for catching up.  Every time I visit Vegas - I come back here to catch up with friends after dinner.  Servers are very friendly and accommodating.  Pistachio latte or even frap is really good. You can't go wrong with them. Tea here is also great. it comes in a teapot with 2 teacups. They will fill up the teapot with more hotwater (refill) if you ask them. They're very nice about this.   If you sit outdoors, they have heaters outside that do a good job of warming you up.  Reliable, great place. I like this tea-shop a lot, and I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Cherish
Reviews.Content: Pistacio frappes are amazing. They could use more ice cream on their honey brick toast. Price..... It's a little too pricy for being a cafe, but it's still good. I love it's uniqueness!

Reviews.Author: Izzy
Reviews.Content: I've come here a couple times and I really enjoy the atmosphere. The honey toast is delicious and their lattes are consistently made well and look great. Lattes cost about $4.50 and the honey toast costs about $8.50. The wait time isn't too long and it's a great place to come and chill. A lot of people come to socialize, read, or just do homework. I wish the tables here were a little bigger though. I usually come with a group of 5 or 6 and the tiny circular tables aren't the best.   The bottom line: Serenade is a great place if you want to relax and enjoy a good cup or tea or coffee, but just don't expect it to be cheap.

Reviews.Author: Jeanne
Reviews.Content: Green tea latte ice was to powdery and sweet. Service was not to hot!! Not to friendly or helpful when you order. Maybe come again just to try something else. Environment is very cozy and warm. Great place to read and do homework.

Reviews.Author: Roxane
Reviews.Content: Serenade makes me happy:) I absolutely enjoy their Pistachio Latte and their plain Honey Toast. Their honey lemon tea is amazing too. I am all about simplicity, and this place is it. Simple, but doesn't sacrifice quality or creativity. Only gripe would be space, since they're always usually packed mostly during evenings. But overall, this place is warm and cozy. And there's something on the drink menu for everyone. They also have varieties of Honey Toast. Never have tried any other desserts that they offer, but I can tell you their Honey Toast doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Rhonaree
Reviews.Content: Maple Story Belgian Waffle:  Soft, warm waffle with hint of cinnamon.  Generous walnut and almond chunks.  Vanilla ice cream with drizzle of syrup.  It wasn't too sweet, and the balance of soft and crunchy was perfect.    Pistachio Frappe:  FAVORITE!!  I'm currently pregnant, no the fact that it's caffeine-free is icing on the cake.  Although, I'll be drinking it pregnant or not.  It's just the right amount of sweet, and has that delicious pistachio taste.  It's also really good as a hot drink.  Serenade (Red):  Fresh red grape juice!!  So refreshing, and natural tasting.  No artificial aftertaste.  Perfect for summer!!  SERVICE/ATMOSPHERE:  Basic, barista-type service.  Place your order at the cashier, and wait for your order.  It's a cute Parisian themed coffee shop run by Asians.

Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: First time here and I tried the Pistachio latte. It was delicious and the girls were super sweet. The desserts looked super yummy but I didn't have time to try any. I will totally come again and carve out a few extra minutes for dessert tasting! :)

Reviews.Author: Kiki
Reviews.Content: Awesome spot. It is different then any other coffee type shop in vegas. Honey bread and hot chocolate is the best!!

Reviews.Author: Neil Ryan
Reviews.Content: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  Limited dessert options. There's different sets of tables and chairs that don't make sense together in a space.  LIKE  Honey toast. Seasonal drinks. Window murals and overall decoration of the place. Open late.  LOVE  Honey lemon tea. Handwritten menu on the chalkboard.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: It's a bit tough to find, but it's In the corner by Polecats.  It's a Korean run shop and the decor is quite nice.  There a few tables inside mostly set up for smaller groups. It looks like they might have outside seating when it's not so cold.  The tea lattes are actually pretty sweet, but had a good milky flavor that gave the drink a creamy consistency.  The regular teas are for two and cost about double their other drinks.  We tried the Fiji (pineapple, guava, green tea) and overall I think it had a pretty weak flavor.  Cappuccino was good.  They put a bit of chocolate dust over the top.  The Very Berry Waffle was also pretty good. The waffle was warmed up and went well with the ice cream. The berry sauce was also pretty good.  The service was good and it was really warm inside.  Overall I'd visit again to hang out and chat with friends here.

Reviews.Author: Native
Reviews.Content: Dude. dude. dude. I just copped a white mocha, with an extra shot and almond milk. Whomever was my awesome barista this evening is helping me get my night started right. It is my absolute new favorite drink in town. Kudo's bro.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Serenade! This hidden gem is definitely a day maker. They serve the most incredible teas and pastries! The prices are reasonable and everytime I have visited, I have not had a bad experience! The staff are really friendly and attentive to all customers needs. Also, they have free wifi! Serenade, you are my favorite tea spot.

Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I remember when the shop owners of Serenade would come to UNLV and distribute little flyers to promote their new café. Now, Serenade is frequently packed when I come in, and for good reason.  Although the drinks and desserts here are delicious, the main reason why I come here with friends is the mood this place creates. This café is easily one of the coziest and most comfortable spots in the entire city of Las Vegas while also giving sappy little me a romantic  in-an-Asian-drama  feeling. There is no other way to put it, the décor here is on point: The menu display is a chalkboard, the windows are decorated with amazing sharpie art, and there is a small stage up in the front of the café appropriate for its name.   The staff are extremely nice and will bring orders to tables if they have time. They are more than willing to explain the different items on their menu and will make recommendations for newbies. They work quickly even when it's busy and always pay attention to whether their customers need anything.   The pricing for the drinks is pretty average. If I remember right, and nothing has changed, there are free refills for teas, which is perfect for people who plan to sit down for a couple of hours to talk. There is both indoor and outdoor seating for customers, and the staff members are very accommodating towards bigger groups, as well.   I honestly think this café is a place that people have to visit at least once to experience the picturesque atmosphere I'm raving about. There is nothing that has come quite as close in my experience yet.

Reviews.Author: Josanne
Reviews.Content: ..um yea. Vibe: unwelcoming and constant staring from both workers and customers... seriously... what? Tea: I feel like they took my money because I ordered a simple earl gray and they burned the leaves with boiling water. 10 minutes after recieving the pot of tea one of the workers came over and asked if i wanted the water to be hotter because it wasn't sitting on the tea candle... -_- .. really.. no thanks. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Sharz
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to study if you're the kind of all-nighter (or up until 2AM) study bug. They're one of a few places in vegas open late for studying and for some coffee.  I'm a fan of their macarons, lattes, and most of all their HONEYTOAST! It's so yummy compared to other honey toasts I've tried. The ambiance is peaceful although it could get busy and loud, but nothing like a good pair of earphones to fix that!  They've got a subtle interior with cute pictures and quotes drawn on their windows and there's a lot of seating inside and out. It does get crowded though when everyone's coming into the shop. During the seasons they do extra with decorating their front/cashier area which is cute and sets the mood for the holidays! I'm not a fan of their food items but everything else, I'm all in! It's a great place to talk over a cup of coffee, or study, whichever you prefer.   The workers deliver your order to you so you don't have to wait while standing, and they're very quiet, but they do their best to welcome and thank everyone in the shop. Mostly asian workers (seems like a family business) and the music varies but will always have some kind of kpop or jpop (I'm really not sure what kind of asian it is, sorry lol). But like I said, you can always put in your earphones and study away!  I recommend this place for those who live in the area and who's looking to find a place to study late at night!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Serenade has pretty modern interior design. I really enjoyed the relax atmosphere with Korea pop music in background as soon as I walked into this store. There were not many pastry options when I visited. So, I ordered the special item, lavamour ($12), from blackboard. It was like a lava cake with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. It also came with a small cup of milk that you can pour in. Lava cake was very moist. Vanilla ice cream tasted like Häagen-Dazs one. I also tried pistachio latte and chai tea. They both were super milky in the good way. (I especially liked my pistachio latte.) I probably would enjoy both of them even more if I didn't have lavamour. Barista told me he can make less sweeten coffee per request. I will come back for more pistachio latte and maybe try their famous garlic honey toast!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Simple cafe that does it's job. coffee, pastries, etc.  There is nothing overly unique or spectacular about this place.  If you're nearby and you want a coffee this place will serve its purpose.

Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: This is place is great!  Their menu is fantastic and even the pickiest of eaters will find something that's amazing .  The food is always fresh and they have great daily specials.  The parking is easy as they validate, for the lot at the Office building the cafe is in.  I've enjoyed breakfast, lunch and coffee beverages here.  Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: Just tried the vanilla chai tea frappe. A delightful frozen blended alternative to the hot regular chai latte. At first I thought that the two flavors would overpower the other where one is lost in the mix but that's not the case in this scenario. In fact, by some stroke of genius the two flavors somehow manages to heighten the other. You get that sip of vanilla goodness and then at the end that spicy kick of chai suckerpunches your taste buds :D Try it out!

Reviews.Author: Naomi
Reviews.Content: GREEN TEA LATTE!  This is definitely a cute little cafe! Korean owned as you could tell from the Korean music that they play! The place have about maybe 10 tables inside & they have a couple of tables out on the patio area. simple decor. Cute little hand drawn paintings on the window. Definitely a nice place to hang out w/ friends or by yourself when you wanna have some quality alone time w/ your computer while having a nice drink.   The staff is friendly & they bring your drinks or food out to you when you dine in.   GREEN TEA LATTE $4.50- This latte is just PERFECT!!! i love the perfect amount of sweetness & creaminess while still kicking out the flavor of green tea to it! Plus they make it all PURRTTYYY!! w/ a little flower design w/ the foam.  CHICKEN PESTO SANDWICH $8.75 - This sandwich was a lot tastier than i thought it would have been! The bread was warm & toasted w/ the perfect amount of crunch to each bite. Although i did have to push the sandwich down a little to fit in my mouth. The PESTO was a perfect amount & not overwhelming. Served w/ a choice of salad or chips, of course i chose the potato chips since having a sandwich is already healthy enough for me. ahahaha

Reviews.Author: Geselle
Reviews.Content: Serenade is the cutest little coffee shop. I love the artwork they have on the walls, and the beautiful chandeliers give it a nice look. I come here a lot with friends for late night hangouts and sometimes I come by during the day to study and do homework. At night it's really busy and can get loud, but the atmosphere is great. The staff is always nice and serves with a smile! I always get the plain honey toast. It's the best I've had, ever!!! Some people say Ichiza is better...I tried it, and no way! The honey toast at Serenade is 10x better. Their ice cream is super yummy. I like to also get the hot black tea or hot green tea. It's cute how they serve it in a pot. And it's refillable. I've ordered the white chocolate dream and it's very creamy and tasty! This place sure is great to go to! :)  I love this quote on their window,  Chocolate, men, coffee...some things are better rich.

Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked that a customer wrote about poor customer service here because I just had the loveliest time coming to serenade! The atmosphere is charming and the staff are helpful. As a fan of Korean things, I enjoyed the feel of the cafe with its Korean music playing in the background. I ordered a Spanish Latte and it was sooo incredibly yummy. I've also had their coffee in the past and its top notch. They do their lattes really well here, and I'm not even a latte person. This place is quality

Reviews.Author: Jemia
Reviews.Content: First off , download the app: Epoxy so you can get an e-stamp card on your phone :)  They got coffee , tea , and desserts. This cafe isn't exactly spacious , so bring a friend or two but I wouldn't recommend this place for a large group. Otherwise , it's a pretty laid-back place to be at with a few friends , maybe to study since it's open late as 2 am. I like that they have charging outlets along the wall. They also have outdoor seating but the ambiance inside is so nice. The hot tea gets you free refills. My favorite is Fiji. I've tried the pistachio latte everyone talks about , but I didn't really like. Green tea latte and frapuccino were good though.  Their honey toast toast is bomb. Tried the berry toast and the cookie monster toast , but I love the original with vanilla ice cream the most. No thanks to the garlic one though.

Reviews.Author: Krista
Reviews.Content: This is now the second time I've come in here and I truly regret the decision. As much as I hate Starbucks, I should have just gone there. First off why in the world am I paying $8 for green tea? I could have driven over to one of the many Pho places and had green tea AND lunch for roughly the same amount. That's ridiculous, but I wanted tea and half their selections were sweetened so I settled.   The staff was kinda nice but then again there was a HUGE communication barrier which I find frustrating when all I'm asking is which teas don't have sugar. I finally get settled down and notice the music BLARING. I mean good grief, really? Are coffee shops supposed to be to relax, chat, or do work? I had to put in my headphones and turn the music up to block out that music. Kinda hard to work like this.   Now as I've sat here a LARGE group of 18 year old girls have taken up one table but no one has a drink, dessert, or anything purchased in front of them. Good thing because they are so busy screaming that I would hate to see what would happen if they had an ounce of caffeine or sugar. Seriously, I can hear them over my headphone but the staff is just standing behind the counter playing with their phones. Probably their buddies so hey, who cares of they might be annoying paying customers.   With all the selections in this town, I see no reason to come back in here again. I really, really, really wanted to support it since it's local but I don't feel like having to complain just to get a reasonable chill environment. At this rate I could have just gone down to the bar

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Atmosphere is relaxing and comfortable. Staff is extremely friendly and kind. Coffee drinks are excellent and reasonably priced. Hard to find from the street, but once you do you will be returning.

Reviews.Author: Gerry
Reviews.Content: This cafe is a great place to chill alone or kick it with a few friends. It's also a great spot to study or do personal work. It isn't the biggest cafe out there, but it didn't really bother me. I personally love coming here to sip on some hot pistachio latte w/ soy milk and crack open them books. Their hot teas come with refills! So if you want that bang for your buck I'd highly recommend any of the hot teas they offer. It can get really busy on the weekend evenings especially during mid terms and finals week. This place has a relaxing ambience and very friendly staff. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Author: Iggy
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was driving to the ends of the earth but the drive was worth it! Head south on Rainbow, the farthest south you've ever driven, and you'll find a charming oasis in the middle of a sprawling suburban desert. Relaxed vibes, colorful and creative decor, and some down tempo Jamiroquai provide for a pleasant morning coffee date. Wether alone with a book or with good spirited company, Serenade is a great spot to pass those mid morning hours.

Reviews.Author: Ramil
Reviews.Content: Where was Serenade while I was in college?! Probably the only coffee shop in town open late that isn't Starbucks. The ambiance really makes the place because the drinks are just good, but nothing to run home about. They should have booths rather than the small tables and chairs. The booths would make it a better study spot and certainly more comfortable. I had the toffee caramel drink, pretty good, but they use some type of powder like the Coffee Bean does so I guess that doesn't constitute them as using  real coffee.   As others mentioned the honey toast is better than Ichiza, really delicious maybe even better than Guppy's? It is located at a odd spot of the Smith's shopping center on Rainbow and Windmill and pretty hidden. The only good thing is that you can park on the street, which is right next to them. I will be here probably to have chit chat sessions with friends since it is nice place to just chill.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: This place is an amazing coffee shop. The pistachio latte is a must as well as their toffee coffee frappe! The cashiers and barista are very nice and friendly which was another plus.  The ambiance and overall feel of the place is very relaxing and it also gives off a very laid-back, but upbeat coffee house feel. I think it's something that you don't see a lot of here in Vegas.  The pistachio latte is a must-try! Along with their toffee frappe. Their lemonade is also really good and it had a very strong taste to it and it's super fresh and refreshing! Something that you simply can't find in a grocery store or other places. Their honey toast is also very delicious and has the right amount of sweetness!

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Wow! Great late night coffee shop! We ordered the cafe latte and the kona mocha frappachino. My husband ordered the teramisu and I was debating on the cheesecake vs the Italian lemon cake. The guy was real helpful in helping me decide. I went with the cheesecake. He mistakingly brought the lemon cake and said no worries keep the lemon cake and brought a cheesecake!!!! I got to have both cakes I wanted for the price of one!!! He was all smiles and pleasant. We will be back for sure ! The service was great and The latte was even better!

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Love this place for my late night coffee fix! I'm not one for black coffee but this place changed my mind, there Ethiopia coffee is to die for. But my regular fix is the Spanish late!! Yum!!

Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: Went here for a late night catch up session with my friend.  Had an iced green tea latte and honey brick toast.   The green tea latte was like any other green tea latte from anywhere else.   Honey brick toast was good, but not good enough that I wanted to finish it all.   The shop itself if very cute. Felt like I was in a K-drama with its decor and the Korean staff.   I will come back to try other things on the menu though.

Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: Another great place recommended by fellow Yelpers! The hours a little late so you will have to enjoy a late breakfast. Coffee is excellent.

Reviews.Author: Vegas
Reviews.Content: Husband was nice enough to surprise me with a berries n cream honey bread! First time trying it, SO good. Soft center, whipped cream, raspberries, blueberries and ice cream on top. Delish!!

Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Sweet sweet serenade! I like this cute little place. Located in the Smith's shopping center next to Rice and Noodle is where you will find this one of a kind coffee house.  If you like to hang out at a cool little neighborhood coffee/tea house and work on your lap top or enjoy a sweet treat with a love then Serenade is definitely a good choice. They have tea by the pot which is super cool, sweet and savory food choices and on some nights a performer on stage.   The inside is decorated really nicely and the outdoor is perfect for when the weather is nice. They have plenty of plugs for techies and tables for plenty. The prices are ok and the coffees are pretty good. I've had their tea pot, green tea latte, honey bread, bingsoo and strawberry-nade and everything was pretty good. Though they do not serve their lemonade drinks in the cool glass jars anymore they are still so good. The honey toast is amazing and the bingsoo  is ok and can feed up to 3-4 people.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and for date night it's kindda romantic also.

Reviews.Author: Tarek
Reviews.Content: Everything is waaaay too sweet here. Coffee quality not that great. A little of that burnt taste. Their honey bread is really sweet, but delicious. Also their Lemon cake is the best dessert on the menu imo. The rest is ok. 3.5 stars rating, meh.

Reviews.Author: Kla
Reviews.Content: I love the pistachio latte & their honey toast! The ambience is so comforting & welcoming :)

Reviews.Author: Khatherine
Reviews.Content: I am positively in love with this place and I am not an avid coffee drinker!   I strolled in with a friend on an early Sunday afternoon and it was empty. However, that did not frighten me because Serenade came highly recommended in Elizabeth B.'s review. I was actually loving having the place to ourselves. Plus, they were playing indie k-pop :)   We were greeted as soon as we walked in by two very nice gentlemen and they gave us time to look at the menu. I opted for the Vanilla Chai Frappucino and pushed my friend in the direction of the Pistachio Latte (highly favorited) so that I could try hers. We sat down on the comfy chairs after we ordered and just kept looking around the place. I love everything here. I love the feel of it. I love the smell of it. I love the sound of it. I just absolutely love it! When I pulled myself out of Serenade Dream Land, I realized that one of the guys had brought our drinks over to us and asked if we needed anything. This is a sweet touch and I hope that they continue this even when they WILL get busier! Not many places that mainly serve up drinks will kindly set it up nice and pretty before delivering it over to you. You're usually a number waiting to be called.   The funny thing is, we ended up trying each other's drinks and ultimately decided to swap drinks. Mm mm Pistachio Latte. Thanks for recommending this Victoria Q.!   I cannot wait to come back and taste more things on the menu as well as their dessert offerings. I am glad that they stay open late because I might get cravings like I am right now typing us this review.   Come try them out!

Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: The honey toast here is delicious! My husband is obsessed with it now. The only thing that made me a little sad was that our coffees came in to-go cups even though they new we were eating the honey toast there. They even put the honey toast on a regular plate. Besides that, the desserts and drinks are great!

Reviews.Author: Jadira
Reviews.Content: Latte art. Dessert. Cute decor.   This place is awesome!  I came in to study, so I ordered a latte. It came out to $4.32 with tax. I could tell the barista knew what he was doing by the way he steamed the milk and handled the espresso machine ( I've been to places where it Seriously sounds like they're killing animals when they steam the milk). Sure enough, he made a perfect leaf design on top of my latte, then came around to deliver it to me. It was so good, I had to try another drink. I went for the Pistachio Latte, which has no caffeine. I don't usually like sweet drinks, but this one was delicious. I don't think I've ever tried anything like it.   Quality drinks and quality service. How could it get any better? I wish I still lived in this part of the city!

Reviews.Author: Frances
Reviews.Content: I came here for some coffee time with my sisters and cousin. This may be to early to say but this place has the best coffee in Las Vegas I've tasted so far. This cute Cafè has an Asian-hipster-artsy ambience. I'm assuming that they just opened because it seems pretty new and not barely busy; considering we were there on a Sunday. Nevertheless, I guess it worked for our advantage for we were able to find a table right away and no lines at the counter (it's open seating and no table service).   I ordered their Spanish Lattè; it's still incomparable to Urth Cafè of L.A (sorry) but it's still very good. It has the right sweetness and intensity of espresso with steamed milk and served in a cute lattè art. My sister got the Matcha green tea lattè and it's delicious.   This place is also known for their honey toast bread. It's a Hawaiian stash of toasted bread with honey and a scoop of ice cream on top. I almost died because it was SUPER GOOD! We also tried their cookies and cream; which is delicious too!   Parking is not a problem. There's abundance of parking spaces. Plus, it's located in a developing suburb of Las Vegas so it's not busy at all. Definitely, I will Come back next time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I came here because one of my friends had recommended this place to me. She said that I should try the honey toast. I have never tried honey toast before and it was amazing. The baked bread with the honey and the ice cream was a great dessert. I will say that for the size and price, it is best if you have someone to share it with.

Reviews.Author: Lily
Reviews.Content: The honey bread is a pretty large order, cannot attack this solo!  The pistachio latte is absolutely delicious! Also had the italian lemon cake which was yummy. Unfortunately, the guy is finding a new place to order macaroons, so there was no macaroons at the time.  It is a cute little cafe, food place to hang out or even study, but not a very big place. They offer wifi :)  Their drink menu is enticing. Can't wait to try all the other drinks!

Reviews.Author: Seng
Reviews.Content: This place has a good vibe . Opens late and it's nice for a slow and nice conversation with people you wanna catch up with .

Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: This place is great.  I only wish they opened earlier so i could grab my morning coffee from here.  Had the honey bread and split it with my wife, it is awesome so long as you like honey.  Like nothing i have ever had before.  Cappuccino  was also solid, made by a person and not by pressing a button on a machine.  I will be back.  Great decor as well!

Reviews.Author: Antonio
Reviews.Content: Finally a tea/coffee shop on my side of town that rocks! I usually go to another joint in Boca Park, and the drive kinda sucks especially after a long day at work. I brought my friend Tiffany here for the first time and we both fell in love with this place. I've been here quite a few times now and everytime I love the experience. To drink, my two favorite things are the pistachio latte and the Fiji hot tea. When it comes to grub, I absolutely love the Gorgonzola pizza. It's not your typical pizza though. Imagine a crunchy quesadilla that you pour honey on. Weird I know, but trust me it's life changing. I was hesitant at first, but when I took my first bite my mind was blown. Amazing! Best of all it's a block away from my house and they are open late.

Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: Been here several times, especially since it's in our 'hood. They do coffee art here. People study here as they have free wifi. I'll go here more often than Starbucks, especially if Starbucks has no star dash so I can keep my gold status.  HONEY TOAST - 3.5/5 - It was pretty good, and it wasn't super sweet as I expected (which is good because super sweet gives me headaches). The vanilla ice cream balances it out. Their honey toast can be shared by 3 people. I like Ichiza's honey toast better though.  TOFFEE COFFEE FRAPPE - 5/5 - Delish! It's like Twix on coffee. And I normally don't like caramel... I'm pretty sure I'll crave for one soon.  KONA MOCHA FRAPPE - 5/5 - Awesome as well!!! Their mocha taste is not the same as Starbucks. It's more refined, like European chocolate.  RASPBERRY MOCHA LATTE - 3.75/5 - It was a bit too sweet for me.  REGULAR MOCHA LATTE - 5/5 - I had it to go the first time I went here. Even if it was to go, they put art in it which made me happy.  TIRAMISU - 5/5 - It's been a while since I first had their tiramisu, but I remember it being delicious. The sweetness is just right.  CHAI TEA - I cannot rate it since I didn't personally tasted it, but my friend who ordered it liked it.

Reviews.Author: Tiani
Reviews.Content: One of my fave coffee shops here in Vegas! Open late, cute interior, delicious drinks and desserts, what isn't there to like? Though all the drinks are good I recommend getting the popular pistachio latte if this is your first time as it is something you can't get everywhere. I think it tastes better iced imo but on a chilly day a hot one is yummy too! The honey toast is also a popular and if you have the appetite for it I would get that as well as it is one of the better ones I've had. If you're from Hawaii and a fan of Shokudo's honey toast this place is a good alternative to it!

Reviews.Author: Di
Reviews.Content: I like this place . I'm enjoying their teas and deserts . Also it's  open until 2 am . It's great !!! My favorite is zzz tea with French macaroons .

Reviews.Author: Arie
Reviews.Content: With all the hype about this place and the over sensationalizing of their  honey toast,  I was expecting that upon tasting the honey toast I'd be blown away; that it would be a mouth tantalizing dessert, filling my taste buds with excitement. Reality is just not fair.   The toast was not really that special. $7.99 for a toasted block of bread, slathered with some honey, and topped with one scoop of vanilla ice cream. Oooh. But wait... for a $1.00 more... you can get a garlic version. Mind blowing. Don't get me wrong. It tasted good. I just don't think it's worth $8.00+ w/ tax. It's one uncomplicated dessert, requiring no effort at all (except for the toasting and probably the specialized blocked of bread).  I shouldn't have trusted yelp and just trusted my instinct that it's just a piece of bread, not a slice of mouth watering, explosive, tasty piece of food experience.   The drinks we ordered also tasted good. The  matcha milk tea and the pistachio drink. Their pricing were comparable to other locations offering the same selections; $4.99. However, for the same price, I can get a much larger size at a different location. It will taste the same too.   The decor was exceptional. I love the rustic kinda modern but old, whatever you want to call it style. Hey, I'm not an art major. I love the hanging light style. It seems like a good place for something romantic; like a good place to act out a romantic k-drama scene (granted you're ok with sacrificing price for decor: needing to pay mid to high-end price for food which you can get, w/ similar type and quality, at a another location for much cheaper).   For people who just wants to eat, who value price more than decor, your better off finding a different location; offering the same quality and taste of food for cheaper.   However, if your the type of person who values decor and is ok with paying mid to high-end price for food; then this place is for you.

Reviews.Author: Nakeisha
Reviews.Content: It's a cute little place. I love the decor and the atmosphere is pretty nice as well. I would say it's a good place to go by yourself to work or read a book, but it's also a nice little place to go to if you want to socialize with a couple friends. The working staff there are also very kind people and the overall service is pretty quick and efficient.  The very berry waffle is absolutely delicious and the kona mocha frappe is really good as well. I definitely plan on coming back to this shop more often.

Reviews.Author: Kylie
Reviews.Content: Love this cute cafe! it's spacious inside and is a study friendly environment.  it's near my neighborhood which is perfect.  a perfect place to stop by for some great lattes and desserts! I tried their mango iced latte and it was surprisingly delicious.  also tried their green tea bingsoo (shaved ice), tasty and sweet! however it is definitely more than enough for two people.  this is a chill place to meet up with a friend.  it's in the corner next to patty's closet, in the same plaza as Smith's.

Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: Love the service, drinks, food, and ambiance but I left one star out because of the damn kpop music! I know a lot of people who come here to try and study and it's impossible with them loudly playing music in another language.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem in a nondescript strip mall. Best white mocha coffee I've ever had! Chocolate cake was also delish. Great decor (see: Restoration Hardware), very pleasant atmosphere. Tables are nicely spaced. Has an outdoor patio as a bonus. Will definitely come here again and use as a great meet-up spot.

Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: Place is amazing i would definitely go again. The people there are great!!!!!!!!! I love the sandwiches.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Nice little place that was even nicer before a bunch of loud obnoxious customers started coming in. Now it sounds like a bar. Still a 4 start joint in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Clinton
Reviews.Content: I love the service here. They always come around and ask if we need refills on our teas. I also appreciate the live entertainment on Thursdays though I think they need more performers. Although it's a bit pricier than most tea places, it's definitely worth it. Lastly I want to recommend that everyone try their ADE drinks!

Reviews.Author: Kwangtastic
Reviews.Content: Honey Bread!  Bingsoo!  Serenade (green grape)! Nice interior!! Very friendly! Great customer service! if you want to get a cup of coffee or a drink, try this place instead of SBUCKs!! You wont be disappointed! I guarantee that once come to this spot. You gonna come back again and again!!!

Reviews.Author: Dianne
Reviews.Content: Wonderful ambience, relaxing music, and great customer service!! A cool hangout spot for hipsters!! Maple toast, chai frappe, and kona frappe are on point!!

Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: This place is adorable! It's the perfect place to hang out with friends to catch up or even study. I wish this place was closer to where I live. Food and drinks are great as well!

Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: Serenade is my go to cafe for late night honey toast. The decor is very cute/hipster...something you'd expect in downtown LA. It is the perfect place to work from your laptop while sipping coffee or just to stop by for something sweet. If you've never had honey toast, do yourself a favor and order one ASAP! They also have other dessert options such as ice cream and macaroons. They recently created new honey toast concoctions, and they all hit the sweet tooth spot!

Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: Their Chai Latte is delicious! Also, their garlic butter bread is HUGE and is not only for one person (probably good for 4-5) but its a must-try.   The ambiance is great too, you can see lots of people on their computers either studying or working. Great place if you're tired of Starbucks everyday :)

Reviews.Author: Kekona Joie
Reviews.Content: I've been to this exact cafe for about 4 or 5 times now. The interior is beautiful and it has a ton of chairs and tables is wonderful because this place gets pretty packed on weekend nights. There's also tables and chairs outside! Majority of the interior is glossed wood, which is very nice. There's a little stage in the front of the café, which I think is used for karaoke sometimes or spoken word I'm not too sure. Every table is about the same except one which is pretty tall and has more design than the other tables. It has quirky chairs which is pretty cute. Over that table is bunch of hanging lights which are beautiful at night! The atmosphere in the inside is pretty chill, however the music was soo loud this couple next to me and my friends were yelling. I had to go next to my friends face to just talk. We could've sat on the outside but it was waaaayyy too cold for that.    The menu is alright, there's not a ton of things to try but there is a variety. I've ordered the Belgian waffle that had berries all over it (I completely forgot what I've ordered), the green tea w/ honey (a whole pot), the starberryade, the very berry honey bread, and different flavored macarons. I've been really satisfied with all that I've ordered! I was a bit irritated with how long I had to wait for any dessert to be made. I understand that they make it fresh and all that but I had to wait 30 minutes without a quick notice that it was going to take a while.   Overall this cafe is pretty good! The food is great, the atmosphere is not too bad, and the staff are great. If they could just adjust the volume and notify the customers about how long their desserts take, that would be great!

Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: Super cute coffee shop. Went after school to do some studying. After seeing pictures of the inside, I knew I had to come. I was worried there wouldn't be an outlet for my laptop, but there are power strips on the walls; which is perfect. We got drinks and the berry honey bread. If you come here, you HAVE to get it. I'm not sure how they create that magical goodness, but it is so fantastic! Will be back for the honey bread!

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I love it here! Such a cozy cute place to drink tea or coffee and hang out. The employees are very friendly and love the ambience. They were nice enough to put Happy Birthday on the honey toast:)))

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hype.....I'd rather go to a Korean karoke joint..  The drinks are ok as well as the desserts, but why go here when you can go to sambalatte, grouchy john's, the lodge, or better yet the starbucks inside Vons.  My wife bought a  lemonade  for my 4 year old daughter and after noticing that she wouldn't drink it, I asked her why? She said it tasted like soda, so I took a sip....low and behold there was club soda or sprite in it.  I then asked the barrista if they could just make the drink just with lemonade and she said that it was against store policy and they couldn't make another drink..  I then proceeded to ask why it didn't say on the menu that there will be soda water in the lemonade and that's when the employee could not  understand  what I was saying all of a sudden.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Interesting mix: downtempo K-pop elevator music with good coffee. Correction: GREAT coffee, not burnt-tasting like Starbucks. Good rustic-industrial vibe. There weren't many people here when we visited - there should be! Again: GREAT coffee.

Reviews.Author: Mayeli
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE their Chai tea with soy milk!! Sooooo yummy! I wish they had more size options and coconut milk though:\ their employees are very quiet but they get their job done. I'm kind a clean freak so I get a little annoyed that they don't really clean their windows or dust their cash register especially since their place is SUPER COOL.  I also would like it if they were open earlier but I do understand that they are open until pretty late at night. But I just love their tea too much! Seriously though please dust. Lol

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: 2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge 79/100  This is such a cute little cafe. I went several times with my girls and always enjoyed it.   Must try's:  Iced Pistachio Latte - Not a pistachio fan, but wanted to try something new. This was delicious. It was my 1st time having it, so I can't compare. It had the right amount of sweetness.   Honey Toasts - variety of flavors. Delicious. And more than enough to share with 3 people.    The tea comes in a cute tea pot and cups. It was good enough to share between 3 people and still have some left over. We had the Fiji tea. A fruity green tea with notes of pineapple and papaya. It had the right amount of sweetness.   Service was friendly and light decor is beautiful at night. Good spot for date night, studying, writing, or catching up on the latest shenanigans with your girlfriends.   It gets busy at night. It's quieter and slower on Sunday mornings and afternoons.

Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Serenade, thanks to my Yelp friends! I had the Matcha Green Tea Frappe and it was so yummy that I downed it in a very short while. My husband asked me  Where's your drink?  and he was surprised when I told him I had already consumed it. LOL!

Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: This is our new coffee/dessert spot in town! Great atmosphere, very warm and cozy, free wifi, outdoor seats! Try their pistachio latte, honey toast and the green tea bingsoo!

Reviews.Author: Sylvia
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the atmosphere of this really cute shop with a lofty feel.  I was however quickly unimpressed with their steep pricing. They seem to cater to a younger crowd so you would expect the pricing to be a bit more reasonable.    I did order their chai latte and i really liked it, but it is not my first cup of chai so i think it's safe to say it was some kind of packaged product.
