My hubby ordered the pistachio latte  which was amazing however both drinks were not as hot as we would have liked them to be.    He also ordered a $9 waffle with pecans, maple syrup and whip cream which I thought was terrible.   It was dense and like a sourdough type of recipe.  They really pride themselves in their waffles but i have to completely disagree and at $9 it was totally not what I expected and it was also quite small (thank goodness in this case) .  Most of their desserts do however start at $9 so not sure I would want to choose different and be wrong again.   I am not sure about this joint yet, as my lasting impression of this place seems to be the high pricing and awful waffle. They do offer free WiFi and the service was pleasant.

Reviews.Author: Nelson
Reviews.Content: So you got K-BBQ, K-Pop, K-Drama, and now in the Southwest area, a new K-Coffee Shop called Serenade(Ooooh...so romantic!) which has been well received by the Yelp Community.  Clean, spacious, free wi-fi, and outdoor seating...bonus! So lots of yelpers and their grandma have been raving about this Pistachio Latte, so I ordered that, and Wifey ordered the Chai Latte which were $4.50 each. The dessert case had cakes, cheesecakes, and macarons, but nothing that I was in the mood for, until one of the servers sells me on their Maple Story Waffle, $9..Ouch!  My Pistachio Latte was very creamy, nutty, and delicious, and although I'm not a fan of Chai, wifey's Chai Latte was pretty good. The Waffle though, was kinda disappointing. I was expecting a crisp exterior and a soft interior. It felt more like I was a farm animal chewing and chewing on some hay. The waffle itself is pretty small topped with vanilla ice cream, maple syrup, and toasted almonds really wasn't worth it.  I will return for the Pistachio Latte, but that would be after getting a dessert fix at Suzuya which is nearby and serves up better quality pastries....ALOHA!!!

Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: Korean-style coffee shops are not common in this town and I love non-chain coffee shops. This is reminiscent of cafés I've been to in Seoul so I was pretty excited to try it. Nice modern interior. They have free wifi and multiple wall outlets for laptops and other devices.  I wanted to try their macarons but they're not available. They don't make them here and they order macarons elsewhere and would take a few days. Since I live quite far from here and don't have the patience to wait 10 days, I got honey toast and what most people have been raving about - pistachio latte. Honestly, I was not that impressed by the pistachio latte and I should have had the green tea latte instead. All Korean coffee shops I've been to have latte art but I didn't see it on mine but no biggie. I haven't heard of anyone who died due to the lack of coffee art. But I did not taste pistachio in my latte. However, I did enjoy their honey toast. The toast was nice and buttery, lightly drizzled with honey and topped with vanilla bean ice cream. Yup, better than Ichiza's version.  So the next time I'm in the area or if I get so bored and want to drive 20 miles, I'll come back here. Oh, let's not forget those nights of drinking and I need a pick-me-upper, this place is open til 2am! Yay!

Reviews.Author: Rngox
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Atmosphere,  great little hang out to meet up with friends. The coffee was yummy! The honey bread topped with ice cream was a treat. Gotta stop in to try that alone. Reminded me of Korea's coffee shops. So cute!

Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little cafe where people can chill with friends, study, drink coffee & tea, or eat dessert.  Honey Toast: It was really good! I've been disappointment at other places because they were either too dry, not enough butter, not enough honey, etc. But their proportions for each ingredient was sufficient! My only complaint is that I wish they gave more ice cream   Fiji Tea: It was really good as well! It's lightly sweetened & you can add more hot water to your teapot. I filled up mine at least 2 times & the flavor was still there.  Their display case & presentation for the desserts, though, could be improved to match the cafe decor. It just looked very dull to me, like the ones in a school or hospital cafeteria. Not to be nit picky, but it's the little details that make a huge difference for me.  Despite this, I'd still come back & try other drinks & desserts.

Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: I came here a few times when it first opened and I truly enjoyed it. However, I came here yesterday and the food tastes different. The maple story waffles, which were my favorite, taste bland compared to what I remember. I was disappointed because I live in Summerlin and I drove all the way out here for food that wasn't very good. The drinks are still tasty. However, I will not be driving out of my way to come here anymore.

Reviews.Author: Kirstie
Reviews.Content: Yelp 100 Challenge 14' * 20/100  Korean-owned cafes have their own unique flair - cushioned metal chairs, Asian flavored frappes (matcha green tea for example) , chicken curry/salmon croissant, cute quotes on the glass walls  Drink good coffee and read good books  (really hit the spot)  Looking back on this crazy month, I wish I set aside more time to just sit down for more quiet/catch up time like tonight. Candy R. and I arrived at the perfect time too because the sun was slowly setting behind Mountains Edge and this bold orange glow masked the whole cafe, really setting the mood for a lighthearted night. She had the pistachio frappe while I got the mint chocolate frappe. All natural flavors. I didn't quite taste the excessive sugar and artificial flavoring that I've grown all too familiar with from other places.   To top it, we also shared an 8  gorgonzola pizza with honey sauce! In my life, I've tasted quite a variety of cheese pairings but never honey. By golly was it supercalifrag. Pizza crust was (for the lack of a better description) in between a pita bread and tortilla - crispy on the edge but chewy towards the center. It certainly serenaded the beautiful view we had of the mountains. And who could complain about the free wifi, prompt service and cleanliness of the place. It was certainly almost rustic in a sense that it resonated this this vintage and very much elegant environment - wonderful for girl time and good conversations.

Reviews.Author: Ting Ting
Reviews.Content: The iced mango macchiato is SO BOMB. Strong, yet subtle mango taste--just how I like it. This place has a great ambiance for studying and socializing. Can't wait to try the pistachio latte next time!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: Today was my first visit here & I'll be a regular from now on! I loved the atmosphere and fun music they play! The service was spot on and very friendly! I tried the Iced Pistachio latte with Soy milk and it was so amazing! I recommend this drink to everyone & especially those who are vegan, because there is non dairy options.

Reviews.Author: May
Reviews.Content: The only cafe that I can feel comfortable at. The music is good volume, the drinks are great, & their desserts! It gets pretty packed tho especially when I want to study there and have no table.

Reviews.Author: Brieana
Reviews.Content: Came here with my friend and absolutely loved the place. The Pistachio latte was EXTREMELY delicious. They brought our drinks and dessert out to us and it was all very nice. We also tried their waffle and their honey toast. The waffle was just crunchy enough on the outside and soft and fluffy inside. The honey toast was pretty amazing as well.  The cafe was pretty cozy and intimate and the baristas seemed very knowledgeable and made some great suggestions. I will DEFINITELY be back here!

Reviews.Author: A
Reviews.Content: LOVE: Delicious Drinks (way better than Starbucks) LIKE: Decor theme DISLIKE: They don't have coconut milk (I'm in love with the coco), the macaroons (yuck).

Reviews.Author: Brent
Reviews.Content: This is strictly a coffee rating, i have not tried the desserts. Typical of many Asian cafes i find the milk to be steamed a bit hot in an effort to get fantastic latte art. Which is great if you like art more than you like coffee. Kidding and foamy cappuccinos aside it is pretty consistent, the staff is friendly, the shots are good, and where the hell do you get a good espresso with a ceramic cup and a chair AT 1 am? Right here.

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I've had this spot bookmarked for ages, but I don't make it to this area very often. Finally, one day this week I decided to stop by and make honey toast my lunch. On a weekday afternoon the shop had a quiet, mellow vibe. The inside of the shop is very clean and has a rustic feel.   The Honey Toast is what brought me here, but the Pistachio Latte caught my attention as well. I went for the Berry Honey Toast which was topped with raspberry sauce, blueberries, raspberries, whipped cream, and ice cream. They Honey Toast was a huge dessert that would be enough for two to three people to enjoy. It was crusty on the outside and stretchy dough on the outside. Both the inside and outside were delicious. The melted ice cream on the doughy inside was delicious. I can see why this is a popular dessert. The Pistachio Latte had the perfect amount of pistachio flavor and I loved every sip.   The menu is focused on coffee, flavored drinks, lemonade style drinks, teas, and honey toast. I believe I saw one savory option, but that is not their focus. The menu seems limited, but they seem to be focus on serving items that they do well. I would definitely return for the amazing honey toast and pistachio latte.

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: Coffee for those who care about coffee.  New to the South West, Serenade is a wonderful cafe that appears to cater towards artistic/hipster/single origin coffee lovers. Serenade's environment is accented from the window art on the exterior to the four artistic walls ranging from wood, brick and art covered concrete. There are quite a few indoor seating options as well as outside covered seating. Coffee is available single origin in pour over and the espresso is made by a single La Marzocco. Free pouring latte art is typically hearts with the occasional rosetta. Tea is served in glass tea pots on a stand. Signature drinks include the Pistachio Latte and the Choco Latte (both non-caffeinated). Both are incredible, especially the Pistachio, available hot or frappe.   Customer service is superb for a cafe. Ordering is painless and both for here and to go drinks are brought to your table. Free internet is available and there is plenty of space between tables so you won't be bumped and can study uninterrupted. The overall experience of Serenade is fantastic, allowing it to be a contender in Las Vegas's meek options of up class cafe's.

Reviews.Author: Ty
Reviews.Content: Ok, ok, ok! We're all watching check-in after check-in...how can you not stop by to try it?! I know I had to. First of all, this place is so cool. The hand painted stuff on the windows, the little stage up front and one of the coolest chandelier like light things I've ever seen. They also have a little basket full of blankets for people to use outside when it's cold, which I thought was awesome.    This was my first honey bread/toast experience and I think I'm addicted! The inside part of the bread kinda melts together and gets so gooey and buttery...dang it, it is good! Topped with the vanilla bean ice cream and honey, it all just comes together and makes for an awesome treat. My wife also had the infamous pistachio latte which is just a cup of frothy, nutty and creamy deliciousness! I got a kona mocha frapp, it was good but nothing spectacular like the other items.  So, yes it's a little on the pricey side and it gets so busy you may be waiting a bit..but it's worth it. We live way up on the NW part of Vegas and we're already wanting to make the trek back for more!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This is my first time here and when I walked in I thought the cafe was super cute! When I went to go order, the woman who took it had such a negative vibe and didn't even smile or anything which kind of threw me off but whatever. I ordered an iced white mocha and a Belgian waffle and the Belgian waffle was so expensive for how much they gave you, it was like a small circle with a glop of ice cream and berries all over it, I would expect more for it being $8 to be honest. My coffee was good except for it being too sweet in my opinion, I could feel cavities forming and those cavities giving birth to baby cavities, so if you enjoy really sweet drinks then I'd recommend it. My friend got the toffee coffee frappe and she enjoyed it as well, just the right amount of sweetness and coffee flavor. This place overall is cute and the foods really enjoyable and so are a few select coffees that they have, I hope they reduce their prices though.

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Came here on around 3:45pm on a random weekend trip to Las Vegas. My friend who lives here told me about their pistachio latte so I came in to give it a try. When I first walked in, I felt I was in a library it was so quiet aside from the occasional blending and some sort of Asian music playing in the background (which I felt was a tad too loud at times). I really like the set-up of this place. There were a lot of students actually studying so it seemed like a well liked place. I came in and ordered the Maple Story Honeybread and a Pistachio latte iced to go. The Honeybread was a little more expensive than I expected at $10 but if was good dessert on a warm sunny day! If your ever here though, make sure to grab that pistachio latte! It's different, not too sweet, just the right kind of milky sweetness. If I'm ever back here, I'd try the pistachio latte hot or the caramel macchiato which I hear is also pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Kai
Reviews.Content: First time going here n I'm in love with their pistachio latte... Cute place to just hang out and drink tea or coffee

Reviews.Author: Bomdor
Reviews.Content: Stopped by here after reading lot of good reviews and the pictures I seen on yelp. We had the green tea, pistachio latte, cappuccino and the toasted bread with ice cream. Everything was really delicious! Highly recommend serenade for a place to grab coffee and catch up w friends. Nice ambience!

Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: Ok drinks. I would say it is more geared to small groups than large groups or individuals.

Reviews.Author: Stefanie
Reviews.Content: As of today, this is OFFICIALLY the most delicious cafe I have ever been to. I generally don't expect much from cafes because they're more or less the same to me. I just love a place with free wifi, black coffee, and comfy seats. I'm not a huge fan of lattes, but oh my god. Their signature Pistachio Latte ($4.50) is deserving of any and ALL rave reviews. It is honestly the best beverage I have tasted, I can't even believe it. The sweetness level and depth of flavor are perfect.  When I checked into Serenade, I was bombarded by messaged from my friends to try their original flavored Honey Toast ($8.50) so I did. Oh man... I'm not even exaggerating when I say that this is now my favorite dessert in the whole world so far. I've had brick toast before, but this just blows all of those out of the water. Three or four people is probably the ideal number to share the Honey Toast because it's super sweet. I love how the buttery-ness is soaked throughout the entire bread, not just glazed at the top.  Oh and they have the best music and overall vibe. Five stars and beyond. I love Serenade.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Honestly not sure how this place got such high reviews, prices are high, customer service was horrible and the coffee just wasn't that good! I ordered the Spanish latte and it had a flat bland taste to it, I told the  barista  and she offered to sweeten it but charged me an extra 50 cents for 2 pumps of vanilla sweetener than didn't change the taste much and seemed to not really want to add the sweetner, last I checked I was the one drinking the coffee and not her! The one good thing I can say about this place is that the decor was pretty creative and cool, that's probably what saved it from a 1 star rating.

Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: As a college student, studying in the house doesn't always cut it and neither does driving to the school to stay in the library for the late hours. Public libraries are closed and starbucks are always busy. So I insisted to my boyfriend that we should study here and check it out. Here's what I found:  Setting:      Location is unusual because it's hard to spot from Rainbow, but it's tucked away in the Smith's parking lot in the SW area.  Drawn etching  of french style buildings on the glass and I open the door to a simple, urban/contemporary type coffee shop. It's the kind where you would imagine poetry jams or a local acoustic artist gig. (There's a lit corner that is elevated into a mini scaffold as if they might go in that direction)  Small round tables enough for 2 people to sit with maybe a dozen tables. Wooden seating with red cushion covers. A wick basket of blankets is available in the corner if you want to cozy up outside in the patio. Black and white photography framed on the walls and a chalkboard written menu.  What I tried:  The baristas are really nice and take time to do each drink. It's very relaxing actually. Music is like a mix of old style R&B and korean ballads. Pistachio latte tastes milky...really milky with a subtle pistachio taste ($4.50). Has the sweetness of Frosted cheerios. Fiji tea (~$7/pot )which is a combination of three fruit teas reminded me of clear gummy bears. It's not overwhelming but its crisp. ZZZ tea definitely had a floral/herbal taste. I think my boyfriend said its Chamomile and Jasmine for that mix.  Impression :  Goodness. Free wi-fi using business speed internet service. I must have stayed there doing my research paper from 6PM-11PM and they offered me tea refills for FREE! :] It's like a Tea Station by my house but without seating limits before they charge you or a minimum purchase limit for using payment using a card.  Can't vouch for the food yet but basing my rating on ambiance and study venue, this place is adorable. I definitely felt like I was on a relaxing, bonding date with my man (even though we were both were typing away on our papers).

Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this place~ The music is relaxing, the drinks are delicious(especially the pistachio latte & frap.), the macaroons are so~~~ good, the staff is chill, and it's open until 2am~ This place is perfect to hangout with friends or study, and the location is so convenient--next to a smiths and in a plaza that has a hair salon, food place, and a store for shopping.^^*

Reviews.Author: Doriee
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely in love with this place. Love, just love. Every time I walk in here, I just feel so calm and I feel like this place is perfect. Perfect to be alone, perfect to be with friends, and/or perfect place for those extra special moments with your lovable puppy. Yes, I'm a bit crazy in the head xP  It's so hard to find these types of coffee shops and now we have one in Las Vegas! My goodness. The last time I was at these types of coffee shop, it was in NYC and I severely miss those times (as I always say in my reviews.) I'm just so very very very happy that there is one in the city I live in so I could run to there and have a peaceful moment.   I suppose when you look at it, it'll give you the feel of an upscale Asian coffee shop. Then when you dig a bit more, you'll realize that it's a Korean coffee shop.   Now, you may ask...What's the difference between Chinese/Viet/Korean coffee shops? Aren't they all ASIAN. Well, to be truthful, it's the ambiance and the usually, the decor. The feeling I get when I walk into Serenade is completely different than the feeling I get when walking into Tea Station. And I hope you do too ....   As people have mentioned before me, the place was clean with cute decor all around -- quite modern. They have free wi-fi and an outdoor seating area with heat lamps for those cold weathers. So two out of three times, I've gone to Serenade, ordered a drink, and just sat there studying/reading.  So far, I've tried a few things on the menu.   Fiji tea: This tea smelled fruity but does not taste the same as it smelled. I would definitely recommend it. The aroma is very good. I think out of all the teas we've tried so far, this is my favorite.  Green tea: Your usual green tea. Nothing too special about it.  ZZZ tea: This is a tea with lavender and chamomile. I've actually never had lavender and chamomile tea before so this is my first time. It smelled quite herb-y but the taste wasn't so bad. I'm not sure if it was the tea or if I was just exhausted but I could barely get out of bed the next day. My friend had the same issue. Who knows! Maybe this tea just packs a huge punch! Gotta say, I may not want it again! HAHA!  Buccaneer tea: This smells deliciously amazing. It is a chocolate with coconut tea and you definitely smell the coconut. However, when you drink it, you may be a little confused cause it tastes absolutely nothing like how it smells. It's actually decent and it has an amazing aroma/depth to it. Definitely recommend this.  Honey lemon tea: This is their winter special. I personally really like honey lemon tea because the honey in it is very good for your throat, especially on winter nights or if you're coming down with something. However, their version has a little bit (or a lot) more honey than I can bare. I thought I was going to have cavities while drinking it. I actually had to get them to put more water into it to dilute the sweetness. Yikes! Half honey is ok for me on this one!  Pistachio latte: So many people have been raving about this but ... to me, this just tastes like sweet steamed milk. I can't quite taste anything else in here. Maybe because when I tried it, I was still a bit sick from my cold so maybe my taste buds have been tampered with? But then again, my friend tried it too and we had the same consensus. It was yummy, yes, but it's nothing I'd get addicted to. I do want to try their frappaccino version though :)  Serenade green grape juice: This was yummy! They had two types of grape juices -- a red grape and green grape. I asked the barista which one was better. He said the red grape one is sweeter but the green grape is more refreshing. I'm not typically a sweets person so I chose the green grape and I loved it. On top of it, it came in a cute jar haha :) Definitely recommend.  They are still very new so I'm hoping their menu will expand to include a bigger variety of teas. Other than that, I can't wait to go back to try some of their dessert items like the patbingsu/bingsu, Belgian waffle, and honey toast :)  PLUS SIDE. They are open until 2 am! Definitely taking my significant other here when he comes back into town!!!

Reviews.Author: Aysha
Reviews.Content: Serenade is definately a place I would hang out in with a few friends.  The interior is athsthetically pleasing and the honey toast is pretty brilliant but a tad pricy considering that some places offer the snack for half the price.  The beverages are also a bit more on the pricy side as well and a few of them were really a hit or miss for me (concerning the flavor).  Overall it's not a bad place to hang out in, plus it also has a really a cute college vibe going on.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: Nice little coffee haven!first thing that struck me was the Kpop music that was playing.Next it was rich and sleek decor,then it was the aroma of coffee and baked bread.i had the coconut macaroons.Coulnt help but stare at them for a while before scoffing them

Reviews.Author: Teri
Reviews.Content: A late night dessert restaurant is something every area of town needs, and the southwest area is no exception.  So Serenade is definitely a welcome addition to this part of town!   We arrive after 8 pm and most of the tables are occupied by those enjoying hot drinks, on their laptops, or enjoying a sweet treat.  We grab the one large table by the counter and it takes awhile for us to decide.  Ultimately, we get the Honey Bread ($8.50) (aka Honey Toast) with extra honey and two drinks - the Pistachio Latte ($4.50) and the Peppermint Latte ($4.50).  The flavor is quite subtle for the Pistachio Latte and the Husband enjoyed it.  The Little Guy preferred my Peppermint Latte more though.  The honey bread is lovely as usual, but they do offer a Garlic version for 50 cents more.  Apparently it's garlic butter instead of plain butter used on it.   The menu has your standard cafe drinks, hot and cold.  Waffles, cakes, pizzas, and pastries are among the items to munch on.  They offer outside seating and blankets too!  Stamp cards are available via the Epoxy app, so download for your Buy 9 Get 1 Free cards.    Since they are located in the Smiths's Shopping Center, and the same corner as Rice N Noodle and Patty's Closet, there is plenty of parking available.  Free WiFi - look for the pass code on the board behind the register.  Overall, a nice alternative to meet up with friends at for coffee and cake.

Reviews.Author: Mariel
Reviews.Content: Came here with my boyfriend to maybe pinpoint this place as my new coffee spot. Boy, was I disappointed. The place deserves at least the 2 stars because their coffee is pretty okay. I got the mango macchiato, it was good but the lady that made it, poured way too much syrup in it... So I felt like I was just drinking syrup the whole time. And as we were ordering, the girl wasn't listening to anything we said and we had to repeat ourselves at least 4 times. And after doing that, we thought she finally got it, she ended up taking the order wrong. I have a lot of patience for people but she didn't really seem like she was interested or paying attention. I was very disappointed with this place... I really wanted to like it.

Reviews.Author: Dre
Reviews.Content: First time here drove all the way from Henderson to try this place. When we got there we ordered two strawberry-ades. The coffee shop wasn't full and they had three baristas working and we waited 35 mins to receive our drinks and a macaroon. The drinks were okay I can make the strawberry-ade at home when all it is sprite and strawberry syrup than spend $5. I am a barista at a coffee shop and I know time is everything. I have never waited that long for a drink in my life not even at a Starbucks when everyone knows that they're a busy coffee shop. Its a cute and chill place to go to but the service isn't all that great.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Late night honey toast run with the boyfriend during Valentine's Day weekend.  A Yelp search steered me towards Serenade.  A little tricky to find once in the shopping center as it is tucked away in the corner (northwest).    Very nicely coordinated decor-a mixture of stone, brick, and wood paneling coupled with a unique hanging light bulb fixture which caught my eye upon entering. The scene was lively, a mix of younger and older adults. The staff at the front appeared extremely occupied with making orders.  After a few minutes  they acknowledged us and took our order of honey bread (toast) + a pistachio latte. Both orders were made at the recommendation of Yelp reviewers as I wasn't in the mood for any surprises.  I was intrigued by the concept of garlic honey bread but again, decided to not take any chances.    Our order was out within 15 minutes and before any pictures could be taken, our two forks had gone in for the killing. My boyfriend and I have difficultly rationing honey bread in equal parts as we're both hardcore fanatics of the dessert.  The outside of the honey bread was too crisp for my liking but the insides were perfectly soft and doughy.  Accompanied by vanilla bean ice cream (which they initially said they were out of but somehow delivered on) and you have the makings of one hell of a dessert. It doesn't sound like much, slabs of Texas looking toast + butter + ice cream + honey drizzled all over, but sometimes it's the simplest combinations that truly hit the spot. The pistachio latte tasted of cream and milk with a slight hint of pistachio flavoring. I would've preferred a little more sugar be added as the flavor was subdued.    Overall, a nice addition to the Las Vegas cafe scene.

Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Beautiful coffee shop that's open late for us night owls! Would rate 5 stars if they would turn down the volume on the kpop. Loudest and most distracting music of any coffee shop I've visited. Hard to even drown out with earbuds.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Two Words: Pistachio Latte  I love the atmosphere here - it is so relaxing. It reminds me of those cozy coffee shops in Koreatown (Los Angeles). This is a great place to read that book you've been meaning to finish or to study with a friend. There are several chairs and tables indoors and outdoors.   Serenade serves delectable drinks. My favorite is the pistachio latte - it was my lunch that day because I ordered three of them. Yes... it was that good!  The girls are knowledgeable and friendly. Great customer service and great drinks!  Notes: -Free Wi-Fi -Parking: Plenty!

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: A refreshing addition to the SW for delicious coffee and teas. You can see that the owners take special care in preparing your beverage. There is a nice variety of coffee drinks to satisfy your cravings. The pistachio latte is smooth, flavorful and balanced. There is not much for morning pastries or foods, but hopefully that will change as business begins to grow. Can't wait to work my way through the drink menu.  The interior is bright and tasteful, with a clean and slightly hip design. A couch or some plush chairs could help soften or cozy things up a little, so you sink in with your drink. Overall, a happy environment and experience with all the hope that it flourishes in the community.

Reviews.Author: Raven-Joie
Reviews.Content: fun place to just chill out with your asian peeps!   ambiance: 5 - cool, cute Asian hipster place. there are fun and interesting drawings on the windows and walls! also, there are seats on both the outside and inside.   service: 4 - most of the service was speedy, but the honey bread took a dang long time. it is a huge loaf of bread that is made to order, but it just takes way too long. if their crowd gets bigger, they need to speed that process up!!!!   food: 4 - I ordered the chai tea latte and honey bread while my friend took that pistachio latte and the Irish cream cake.   first, that cake was the bomb!! it was yummy, moist, and delicious. it sorta tasted like a creamy drink in the form of a cake.   the honey bread was HUGE. you should share that thing! it's literally a huge block. it was a bit over buttered! they should add something to make the honey flavor come out of hiding :)   The lattes were good, but I don't know why that pistachio latte is well known. a little bit more pistachio was needed because it tasted like good, warm milk. but the chai tea latte was creamy and good, I really liked it!

Reviews.Author: Gayle
Reviews.Content: Cute little cafe with a great atmosphere. Sometimes they have entertainment which gives a great ambience. Weirdly I do love the garlic toast with ice cream. The pistachio little is delectable. Definitely live up to the height!

Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: This coffee shop is one of the calmest shops I've been to. It's nice in the morning with all of the big windows that surrounds it, the shop is beautifully flushed with light. At night, they have the perfect amount of light fixtures around for just enough lighting to calmly study, read, and drink coffee. I have ordered the Blackbeard tea with the tea pot, it's placed on top of a candle bottom so it's also nicely lit and warm. They keep refilling it for you. In the morning, I order the pistachio latte. So good!

Reviews.Author: Ploi
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere, there're outside seating and pet are allowed. Large selection of coffee and tea. Offer option for non dairy like almond milk and soy milk. 3-5$ for frappe and latte

Reviews.Author: Vince
Reviews.Content: Horrible service bunch of Asian workers just sitting outside when they should be working. There's still about an hour left of work to be done. Lost my business and if you want quality service and good tea/food don't be fooled by these disrespectful people.

Reviews.Author: Star
Reviews.Content: I tried their Carmel machiatto it wasn't that good it made me kind of wish I went to coffee bean. The service was good but the place wasn't that nice and I got the vibe it was an Asian only hangout place I felt like the people hanging out there were talking about me. Don't worry I won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Rowen
Reviews.Content: After working out, I was craving for an iced cold tea on a hot night. I was looking for places around and saw that this was open until 2AM which was perfect. It's a cozy little place and the customer service was really good. They have a good selection of drinks but I ended up getting the honey lemon iced tea. I thought it took kind of long for them to make the drinks but I really enjoyed it. My friend got the pistachio latte and she said it was pretty good and not heavy. I'll definitely come back again to try their other drinks next time. Just recently, I tried their honey toast and it was burnt. They also took a really long time to give it.

Reviews.Author: Sabrina
Reviews.Content: I came here to do some work. I wanted a change from my regular visit to Sunrise coffee. It's warm and welcoming environment. Clean and spacious. Plenty of outlets and different sized tables to do work, get together with a friend, or enjoy conversation with a group of people. They have outdoor seating as all. Also they have free wifi, a plus for the tech savvy  :) I tried the green tea latte, delicious and creamy. I can see myself coming here again.

Reviews.Author: Tu Anh
Reviews.Content: Cute little face in the southwest area. I like how the chairs have seat cushions so your bum doesn't hurt if you sit for a while. While I was there, they played a mix of Korean and popular English songs, albeit a little too loud, but that didn't bother me a whole lot.   I read so much about the pistachio latte so I thought maybe I'd try that. It's a 'non-coffee' drink so if you want caffein, you'll have to add on a  shot of espresso, which I did. This drink is way too sweet for my taste - even after adding some dark espresso. I had my friend Tom tried this drink and he agreed that it was too sweet. Instead, he ordered a caramel macchiato and he said it was perfect so I guess maybe I should have tried something else.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: The pistachio latte! Nothing like I had before and it was delicious! So great that I went back the same evening lol

Reviews.Author: Angelica
Reviews.Content: Really trendy cozy style decor coffee and dessert cafe. Free wifi and occasionally have a live performer on the corner stage.  I always come for the Iced Raspberry Mocha which is to die for cause it's different. Just that hint of raspberry makes it so delish.   I have had both their regular and garlic honey toast. Wasn't too sure about the garlic one but it turned out to be very good and actually more flavorful the the traditional one.  I will keep coming back because they do have some drinks that I think would be worth it to try. For example, the iced mango macchiato. The only thing I wish was that they had a little earlier hours cause I work in the morning and they sell coffee. They open at 11 and I am already at work.

Reviews.Author: Eileen
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this coffee/dessert bar, especially after reading so many positive reviews on the place. Unfortunately, this establishment falls short of my expectations.  The first impression of the place was initially very good but as soon as I got to the counter, the person who was behind the pastry display was extremely unhelpful and unfriendly. I tried to give this person the benefit of the doubt but the person did not offer any suggestions or listened to what I was asking about the desserts. This really upset me but I still wanted to try their food.  Looking through their pastry display, I was sad to see that most of the desserts looked pre-made, not fresh, and not made on premises. This completely turned me off to ordering the honey toast at this point. So I just ordered a coffee - which offered nothing really special in taste or creativity. I've had better at other local indie coffee bars.  I hope readers of my review can get a better idea of this place. It seems like this establishment would be good for the  college crowd  since it seems to have a decent reputation and offer a place to study/work. But the quality of the food doesn't justify the pricing.  Overall, I would not recommend this coffee bar.

Reviews.Author: Trisha
Reviews.Content: I came here the other night with my boyfriend to try out some of the honey bread that everyone has been raving about. Really nice environment and the staff is pretty nice. We ordered the garlic honey toast topped with vanilla ice cream and holy s*** it is amazzzing. Never had anything like it. Took a while to have it brought to us but it was worth the little 10 min wait as it was baked fresh. We had it with some honey lemon tea which was okay, had a little too much honey for me. But overall I would definitely go back here.

Reviews.Author: Annika
Reviews.Content: I went here today with a couple of friends and was impressed with the kind service they had. I ordered the pistachio latte and we all shared a teapot of the chocolate-coconut tea. Don't be fooled by the name, the tea was actually really delicious! I think I poured myself at least 10 cups of it. The pistachio latte was also delicious. It was very milky and not too sweet. They even offered free refills on our teapots. Overall the atmosphere is really nice, the service was great and the beverages were yummy. I will definitely be coming back here.

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: ATMOSPHERE:  This place is a great little corner coffee and tea place that isn't branded like the zillion of Starbucks in the country.  There is some great outdoor seating which my friends and I decided to sit because we were pretty loud.  Indoors the vibe is cool, a lot of two-seat tables, and playing some nice R&B and chill hip-hop is a plus in my book.    FOOD:  This place is definitely all about the drinks, although they do serve desserts as well.  I had a pot of the Ruby Sipper tea (Blood Orange and Hibiscus) and it was really great the first time around.  I ended up getting a refill of water and it was just ok the second time (probably should have let the remaining tea steep more) but at least refills are free.  We also ordered some macaroons which were a little too soft and cooled down from being chilled too long, but at least they weren't spoiled.    SERVICE:  The workers there were really nice, let me smell the teas I was deciding between before I made a decision (definitely a plus over just telling me what each tea had).  They were friendly and did a good job of explaining things to us since many of us were first-timers.

Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: It's a cute place but the service is terrible!! The drinks and desserts are over wayyyy overpriced.  Be weary that if you break any of their unlisted  rules  they give you dirty looks until they get the courage to tell you what's bothering them.  My sister was here studying and I decided to surprise her with dinner. I decided to buy a drink and as I paid, the owner says,  whatever you guys are eating, next time take it outside to eat.   The second I sat down, a young lady told my sister,  you need to take your food outside.   ...? Yes...we got it, no food.  I wasn't aware I couldn't bring outside food. Ok, my bad? But no need to say it rudely. You provide this atmosphere where people stay for long periods of time catching up or studying and you get angry for people sticking around? It's not like I wasn't giving them business by buying something.   Something that was supposed to be a sweet surprise ended up being a bad experience.  Overall I just didn't think this place was that special. Local joint with strip prices. You can get better food, desserts, and drinks somewhere else with better customer service.

Reviews.Author: Luisa
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!!! My friend and I love this place. Imagine the  Perk City  coffee shop in Friends...well Serenade is our place!!! We come here about 2-5 times a week (sometimes more) for a great cup of coffee, tea,  their signature Serenade (a sweet apple and grape juice), and desserts.   Everyone of their drink selections is out of this world. They seriously have the best soy green tea latte in town; way better than Starbucks. Their regular hot teas are served in a cute tea pot that you can share with your friends/family; like it's a tea party. All their dessert and food options are very yummy. From their green tea shaved ice to their waffles, and honey toast, you gotta try it all.    The ambiance is very welcoming and cozy. It's a great place to come with friends, family, a date or even if you just need alone time to study. They open early and close late. The customer service here is very much up to par and its definitely service with a smile.   If you haven't been to Serenade you're definitely missing out.

Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: The guys working the register and taking orders don't speak English very well but hopefully they are learning everyday.  Just be patient with them if you have questions or a special order.  I ordered the pistachio latte..it doesn't have coffee in it but it was very good 5/5  I wanted an iced tea and they said the only cold tea they had was the honey plum tea which was also very good. 5/5  I will return again soon. Cute place : )

Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place. It reminds me of Seoul Korea. This is a cute little coffee and pastry joint. The Spanish latte is my favorite from this place. I'm hooked and I just keep coming back. They also have honey toast w/ ice cream (similar to the once Ichiza serves) and waffles w/ ice cream just like in Korea. They use blue bell ice cream for the vanilla flavor as well. Go check out this place and enjoy a cup of latte or two... you will fall in love with this place.

Reviews.Author: Rachelle
Reviews.Content: I love this place, has live music every Thursday. Reminds me of L.A. tea house in Korea town. Must haves: matcha frappe, green grape juice and honey bread.

Reviews.Author: Joanna
Reviews.Content: Dudettes... after your relaxing massage a few doors down, you come here.  And order the honey toast with the most calories!  That's how to splurge - or one way how to, rather.  Ask for an extra ice cream scoop too, if you dare.  Oh but have it with a Spanish Latte... yeah.  And don't plan on sleeping 'til 3am.  So when you get home, turn on your TV and watch as many CSI Miami episodes as you can.  Yeah do that.  Cuz you know you have a thing for Jonathon Togo and Adam Rodriguez.  But when you order the honey toast though, especially the cookie monster, DON'T SHARE IT.  And FYI this is perfect therapy for sadness, boredom, anger (maybe), anxiety for sure, cheat day (whatever that means), and DINNER :D  If I run into you here, and hangout and stuff, remember we each get our own honey toast.  I recommend the Spanish Latte too perfect bitter and sweet balance.

Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: Their toffee frape was amazing,  and their desserts are just as good! Also they're open till 2 am

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Two words. Pistachio latte. I was introduced to Serenade by a few foodie friends who have yet to disappoint me with their taste (pun) in F&B. I don't really understand how this is a  latte  or if there is coffee involved. I was tempted to ask about the construction of this beautiful beverage but instead I decided to keep the mystery alive and just enjoy the journey to the bottom of the cup.

Reviews.Author: Marlene
Reviews.Content: This is my go to place to study and to catch up with a friend! The drinks and desserts are delicious and the inside is so cozy! Very convenient that this place stays open late at night. Only bad thing is music is always very high!

Reviews.Author: Mai
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome, cozy and it serves awesome drinks. My favorites are honey toast (you should try it, it is bread with butter, with honey and ice cream) and green tea frap.

Reviews.Author: Lavi
Reviews.Content: Very Cute place :) Good for chill and hang out with friends  They open till 2 am  Why I have to give 3 stars is coffee, drinks and food is so so ...I don't like it ...  They don't have boba  Not too many options of food ...

Reviews.Author: MarVy
Reviews.Content: A coffee shop that is open till 2am - Cool!  They serve drinks, pastries, and other dessert items.  Inside is spacious and clean. The ambience is casual, a place you can relax and hang out with friends.    ::Drinks:: Of course I got my hot Green Tea Latte. I also tried the regular Green Tea which was served in a clear tea pot that sits on a glass base with a candle inside to keep the tea warm, and two cute glass cups.  Both drinks were good,  I would get it again.  Next time I want to try the Pistachio Latte.  (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=k61luEGYWjJJxK2_LTeVBQ)  (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=DXuIORRUMxruiETryCWaGw)  ::Dessert:: We also got the Plain Honey Bread.  The bread was thick and tall.  It was perfectly toasted and sweet; it's good for two or three people.  The ice cream tasted so good with it!   (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=NO5e0WtLAOYcjheLU6OEVg&select=5jQG8s_PQqPOuj2nbBzSBg)  ::Tip:: Free WiFi  ::M's Notes:: ~Inside seating  ~Parking Lot

Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: I came with the ladies to sit around and relax until a few others were ready to join us for the next leg of our epic day.  I ordered the pistachio latte as a blended drink as it was a rather hot day. It was decent, tasted like having a decent pistachio ice cream. The size was about a 16oz cup and since I got almond milk it was almost $6 for a beverage and I'm not sure if it was good enough to warrant that.   I wanted some sort of sweet but the selection was sparse to honey toast, one kind of cake in the display and a few french macarons so I passed.   The place is pretty cute though and it's open late in a area where there isn't many late night spots. I'll probably try other items off the menu and re evaluate how I feel about this place. First impressions was just A-OK.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Went twice in less than 24 hours! I love cozy little places like this and wish SO much that I could find one in the Bay Area, where I live. It brings me back to my days in South Korea, where cafes like this are pretty common. Anyway, Serenade offers a good variety of drinks with really good beans. I hear the pistachio latte is nearly to die for. They also serve tea in these adorable tea sets. I looked them up online, totally buying some for myself.   The employees are very nice and helpful, the music is soothing, and it`s just a great place to sit and get some work done with a pot of tea and dessert. Or even just to hang out with friends. My only  concern  is the price, but given the quality of everything, the customer service and how well they maintain the place, it`s forgivable.

Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: I stopped by here today to try their drinks and to check it out for a future Yelp Book Club meeting.  I wanted something cold as the day was warmer than I'd dressed for.  I had read the Yelp reviews and the one thing that people had been ordering and liking was their pistachio latte.  I ordered a pistachio frappuccino.  It was quickly made and I took a seat.  The pastry case had been hit by holiday shoppers because there wasn't much left.  I could have gotten something but it was easier to pass this time.  I sat at one of their tables and took a few photos for this review.  Then I checked for wifi.  A locked wifi.  I went to the counter and they pointed to the left side of the chalk menu board and the password is there.  The wifi was pretty zippy, but there weren't a whole lot of people there.  This is a good distance from where I live but when I'm in the neighborhood for something else, this is a good place to stop.  And, this will make an excellent place for our Yelp book club meeting.

Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I just love this cool place.  The service is always prompt and very friendly.  I first tried the Pistachio Latte which is so good that I haven't tried anything else to drink there.   I have it both hot and cold and they are both amazing.  My daughter had a Green tea latte which she said was very good.  The honey toast with garlic is huge and amazing.  It is made onsite so it is always fresh and such a delight.  The crust is hearty and the inside just melts in your mouth.  The garlic doesn't overpower the overall taste so you also enjoy the butter and honey in every bite.  We have tried the other deserts which are pretty good but not made onsite as with the macaroons.        A great place to just sit down and enjoy some great drinks hot and cold and surf the free Wi-Fi.  They have plenty of seating which was pretty comfortable.

Reviews.Author: Dana
Reviews.Content: For dessert, the honey toast and blackberry cheesecake is amazing! I really enjoy their americano and for a wholsesome taste, try the pistachio latte with soymilk. Also the serenade green grape and red grape drinks are my favorite non-coffee drinks.

Reviews.Author: Mac
Reviews.Content: Cute non chain coffee shop!  The decorations inside are cool and I love the murals on the windows.  Try the honey toast or green tea latte!    The outside area is great as well!

Reviews.Author: Desherry
Reviews.Content: This review is strictly for their amazing honey toast! I usually go to Ichiza for honey toast and thought it was just  ok  but this place made me love honey toast even more! I love it, anyone craving honey toast, this is the place to go!

Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: A lot of people seem to like this place so I decided to try it out.  There was nothing special about the drinks and it is over priced. The tea is not strong enough for my taste. I have tried the green tea in a pot and pistachios latte. I don't see what the hype is for the pistachios latte because it taste like syrup to me. I don't enjoy drinking syrup with milk.   They have desserts also such as waffles, toast and cake. I have only tried the Italian Lemon Cream Cake. I LOVE the lemon cream cake but I would only have the cake once in a while. $7 for a slice of cake? No thanks. I would rather make my own.   The environment is really nice. I think a lot of people go there to hang out and study. I feel that the seats are uncomfortable but I love the interior design. The place is nice to look. Serenade is also located in a great complex with great parking.

Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: I love the ice white mocha and ice mango coffee is so good we so tried the honey toast it's good too but pretty pricy!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a great place to study, so of course we turn to yelp. We were impressed with the great reviews so we checked it out.   We walked in and immediately did not feel welcomed. When you walk into a place you've never been before, we all get that blank stare at the menu. Employees just looked at us as if we were inconveniencing them because we didn't know what too order. We eventually ordered a honey lemon tea, green tea frap, and their famous honey bread. The items we were ordered were OK. Music was distracting and loud. Not really the music you expect to hear at a coffee shop. We decided to leave and just head to the library. I would never come here again.

Reviews.Author: Christie
Reviews.Content: Everything surrounding my visit to Serenade was a cluster: my phone locked up, so I left it with a friend to fix, the directions were off (look for the Smith's per Terri R & Amanda M) it was pouring rain...and I'd altered my training all week for a pizza lunch (not a story worth relaying) But, I made it with the mission of meeting Michael U for Garlic and  plain  Honey Toast and the much lauded Pistachio Latte.   We were initially the only customers just as they opened at 8AM ready for our unorthodox breakkie. My heart sure sank as the gentleman (later identified as an owner, Ray) profusely apologized and explained they did not even receive their bread delivery until 1PM. He offered a variety of other pastries, etc, but when he realized how far we'd come and our hearts were set on Honey Toast, he went above and beyond extraordinary customer service...  We noticed an employee leave as we sipped lattes, water and chatted. We even joked  maybe he ran out for bread.  A few more customers sidled in and Ray approached us again asking which Honey Toast we wanted? When we replied  plain and Garlic  he asked if we wanted both with vanilla bean ice cream or whipped cream. We went for the former. They HAD gone out for bread just for us!   It really is an attractive spot in the SW: nice lighting, a heated patio, exposed brick with an open airy feel. Clearly, I was already very impressed with them running out for bread, the Honey Toasts themselves were delicious, garlic is the clear winner, IMO and both trump Ichiza.   As if all of Ray's super efforts were not enough, when we asked for the check he insisted  no charge!  Even for the delightful Pistachio Latte I thoroughly enjoyed, though I'm not a coffee drinker. Many could take a page from this young business owner's customer service ethic. Though it is clear across town, I'll be back and have already suggested Serenade to others. Open until 2AM, I'm sure they will become a more popular spot with such dedication to customer satisfaction.  This visit just cost a tip - and lack of photos on my part due to wonky phone - and while a few others have questioned the prices since most items are not made in house; the service has me sold. Well played, Ray!   3.5 stars, will revisit when I do, and actually pay for experience. 5* + for customer service.   Yelp 100 Challenge

Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: The pistachio latte. It doesn't even have coffee, but it's a good drink to refresh your soul and satisfy your sweet tooth!

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Super cute and really convenient spot to get to. Great drinks and desserts. I'd never tried honey toast but now that I've had it, I'm hooked!!!

Reviews.Author: Cj
Reviews.Content: Good selection of coffee. Approachable prices..Honey toast was tdef on point! The only thing is that this place reminds me of how rude Korean people are.  Seats are like gold.. Over 6 seats being used for backpacks or books.  Had to stand up while my family of three sat down since no Korean people want to give up their chairs. (edit) a nice American gentleman offered me his chair.  Btw I'm Korean so there's that.

Reviews.Author: Ramoncito
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little coffee shop that is sure to steal the spotlight from the likes of Sambalatte soon enough. I came here with my friend last night to enjoy some hot tea. She ordered the Fiji tea, and although I am not the biggest fan of hot tea, i found myself pouring cup after cup of this warming beverage.   I took my parents immediately the next day to try their coffees. My parents in all their travelling wisdom claimed that the Cafe Latte was very reminiscent of the drinks they would order when they travelled Europe. Otherwise an excellent drink.   The only problem we had on our encounter today that i did not face yesterday was the fact that it took particularly long to get the drinks dished out. We waited almost thirty minutes for our coffees and while it was worth the wait, it should not have taken that long. One of the baristas apologized and said that this does not usually happen, so dont start thinking youre in for a bad time. The sweet fellow apologized again with a complimentary irish cream cheesecake (which was sublime, by the way). A kind gesture from a wonderful staff member. Expecting to return soon, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: What is it about pinterest feel coffee shops (DIY interior), subtle soothing tunes and a cozy cup of tea/coffee that gets me?   When I first discovered serenade, there wasn't too many people, as it was a little hidden gem in the corner of the Smiths shopping center.  This place is easily missed due to its location.  However, now a days, it seems that the word is out on this place and is now a big hit! I can't blame it for being a local favorite, because its definitely on my top 5 Coffee/Tea Lounge list.   They offer bottomless tea if you decide to hang out there.  Its cute because its a candle lit tea pot served in unique tea glasses.  My personal favorite is the  Fuji tea . If I'm not having the Fuji, I am sipping on the  Pistachio Tea Latte  for sure! To accompany my tea, their  Garlic Toast  is a MUST! so savory and has the perfect sweetness from the drizzle of honey they add to it, along with the scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yum!  I've also tried their refresher drinks, i believe the red apple. Delicious!  Setting is very modern.  Love their setup.  They also have outside seating and free wifi which is always a plus!

Reviews.Author: Julius
Reviews.Content: Found  another Coffee spot!  This place has a nice vibe and atmosphere with music that compliments it's name,  Serenade . Sipping on my delicious White Chocolate Symphony listening to some John Legend was quite delightful. Will visit again to try out more flavors.

Reviews.Author: Peaches
Reviews.Content: This cozy little place is tucked inside the Smith's shopping center area on Rainbow and Windmill. At first it was hard to find since it is located in a small corner, but the ambiance was really nice. I've never been to a place like that before and although it is quite all on the inside it seems to be the place to go to for desserts and coffee.   I am not an avid coffee drinker, but was able to try the pistachio latte which didn't have coffee in it and it was delicious.   The honey toast smells so good as they are making it and tastes even better when it comes out.   Was also able to try the Cookie Monster. This consisted of a Belgian waffle and Oreos with ice cream. This was also very yummy.   Overall the place was very nice and the food was great.

Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Cool spot to grab a drink, a quick bite to eat, and wifi surf :)  We tried the Pistachio Latte ($4.50). Pretty tasty! Subtle pistachio flavor, but the coffee/espresso was very smooth and went unnoticed.  Since I don't drink coffee often, this is how I prefer the taste.  We also ordered the Honey Bread ($8.50). They have a great version here!  Tasty Vanilla Bean Ice Cream on top of soft, sweet toast. Wish they went a little heavier on the honey though, but I am sure I could have requested more.  I'd recommend checking it out if you are in the area!  Pics :

Reviews.Author: Melia
Reviews.Content: Southwest Las Vegas is probably one of the fastest growing areas in town and it's nice to see places like Serenade popping up amongst the typical suburbia chain stores/restaurants. This cute little coffee shop offers up solid coffee, desserts, honey toast (which is apparently a big deal based on other reviews?) and is complete with plentiful seating and a patio. And I love a good patio.  They're popular for the pistachio latte, a subtly nutty, creamy beverage that's perfect for non-coffee drinkers. Don't mistake that as a slam-I pound a lot of coffee, but sometimes I just want something that doesn't wind me up and the pistachio latte is perfect for that. They also offer a variety of teas (you get an entire pot for about $6-comes with one of those candle warmer things), bagels, desserts, iced beverages and more.  The service is super friendly and attentive! Once you place your order, they'll bring your beverage/food out to you and there's no confusion about that process like there is at say, another coffee shop in Boca Park that still can't seem to clarify whether or not you wait at the counter. I guess my only ding on this place was that the music was kind of loud, but a lot of people were in there studying and had headphones in so I guess it really didn't matter. It's probably quieter on their fantastic patio which I'll definitely enjoy if I'm back here in the warmer spring months.  It is pricier than your average Starbucks, but most small businesses are. You're paying for service, quality and an experience that you're not going to get anywhere else and Serenade offers all of those things!

Reviews.Author: Belle
Reviews.Content: Honey toast with a perfect crisp on its outer layer & melted vanilla ice cream on a bed of foamy moist bread. My cheat meal was well deserved. Perfectly paired with a vanilla latte made just right. I have to go back and ask what beans they use! Customer service was great.

Reviews.Author: Mina
Reviews.Content: Another cute, little hipster cafe! Yay! This place is adorable, their decor is very stylish. It's a little hard to find this place when you first try to look for it; it's in the very corner of the complex.   I ordered the Strawberry Ade with strawberry and salted caramel macaroons. The Strawberry Ade I had was very mellow. They get fresh strawberries, make it into juice and mix it with Sprite. It's super refreshing on a warm day. I got two macaroons, and they were scrumptious. The salted caramel one was a little hard on the outside, but the strawberry one had the perfect texture. I'd say it's a little pricey for a single macaroon ($1.95), but everything else was pretty good to me!

Reviews.Author: Nitin
Reviews.Content: Serenade is one of my favorite coffee shops in Las Vegas!!  I was drawn by their pretty, luscious and decadents desserts. Just so happens, they make great coffee too!! The Triple Layered Cake complements the Raspberry White Mocha Latte perfectly.   I like the ambiance of the place, very relaxing and it's a great place to bring a group of friends.  The staff are nice people and in general the whole place has a positive vibe.   Recommended Indeed

Reviews.Author: Khammany
Reviews.Content: Was here in January and this place hit the spot for a sweets craving.  Their honey toast with berries was soft and warm in the inside and had the perfect crispy texture on the outside.  The ice cream and the tartness of the berries complimented the toast perfectly. I dipped my toast in my latte as well even yummier! Service was fast.  Easy to pay.  Parking galore. The place was clean and cute! The theme and the decor was adorable. I'm was a happy girl.  :)  Happy Oinking!!

Reviews.Author: Pim
Reviews.Content: Cute but so much hype.  I've been waiting for a coffee shop like this ever since I went to Seoul three summers ago. Cute decor, well-dressed employees, good selection of drinks and desserts...How could that ever go wrong?  It's exactly the fact that Vegas is lacking in this kind of establishment that makes me not want to go to Serenade. It's hyped up (because like me, many young adults or students were excited to see such a place open up) and therefore way too crowded. I can almost never find seating, even going alone. A lot of the patrons give off unfriendly vibes as if they're better than me. It's just not very welcoming.  The employees are indeed well-dressed and look polished but they too don't seem very welcoming. The customer service is just alright but nothing that made me go,  oh I am so adding to the tip jar!  The coffee drinks are alright, albeit burnt at times and the tea is on the weak and lame side. The desserts are wayyyyy to overpriced. The waffles had a gummy texture rather than a more appetizing crispy or fluffy texture. It's just pretty.  Everything about this place is just eyecandy. It's nice to go in to check it out and look at everything but the actual service, drinks, and desserts fall short. It's also difficult to enjoy the place if you can't even sit down as well. That could be seen as a good thing for them, from a business perspective.  I like that Serenade opened though; it proves that this kind of coffee shop is very welcome in Vegas. Hopefully similar ones will open soon.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: In love with this place. I've tried too many items to list, everything is delightful. Their presentation is beautiful to look at and even better to enjoy!

Reviews.Author: jerome
Reviews.Content: My nieces and nephews were craving some late night sweets so uncle had to accommodate.   This place was open super late, we got there at almost 1am (yea way past a kid's bedtime but we were playing an intense game of Monopoly).  We had the Very Berry Belgium Waffles and the Green Tea Shaved ice thing. Both were awesome but the kids were partial to the waffles. I was left to finish the shaved ice by myself. Way too much for one person.   All-in-all, a trendy, cozy little hangout spot. I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: This is another coffee shop in Vegas that has a cool interior, and a relaxing atmosphere. My cousin told me about Serenade a while back and ever since then, I fell in love with this place.  Usually, I use Serenade as a place to study and relax with a hot pot of tea. I feel like this place gets crowded during exam weeks because a lot of people come here and use it as their own little study area as well (I mean, who wouldn't?).  My past few visits to Serenade have been enjoyable, except for one night when the music was practically blaring. I'll just consider that night where the music was too loud an outlier because it's usually calm in there... Anyway, the place can get crowded quick (even with their additional outdoor seating) so if you plan on studying, I suggest claiming a table before placing your order.  The staff is friendly, and they answered any questions I had about their coffee/tea. What I like about this place is that they actually deliver whatever you order to wherever you are instead of walking up to the counter to retrieve it yourself. I think this place has customer service invested in their workers.  As for their drinks, I usually just order a pot of tea because I'm there for a while studying. The good thing about the pots is that they are bottomless. That's right - FREE refills! My favorite ones are: ZZZ, Fiji, and Buccaneer.  The ZZZ tea reminds me of the Sleepytime teas. It tastes like lavender or chamomile. I don't know what it is exactly, but it should help you relax after a few sips. The Fiji tea has a pineapple flavor. I really liked this tea, but after a while it gave me a sour aftertaste. The Buccaneer tea is probably my absolute favorite out of the three listed. The flavor to this tea is a coconut/chocolate fusion, which pairs well with their macarons (especially their blackberry or chocolate ones)!  They also have lemonades there. On a different occasion, I went with the serenade drink (just because it's the name of the shop). I didn't quite hear what the barista said about this lemonade, but it tasted like a mixture of kiwi, grape, and/or blueberry. I can't pinpoint exactly what it tasted like, but it was refreshing (and a tad bit sour).  Serenade encapsulates what a good coffee shop should be. They have friendly workers, a great menu with a variety of options, and the ambience is truly unmatched!

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Don't come here.  Terrible service.  Rude asians, bad coffee.  Workers sit outside and act like it's a chore to get up and work.  Starbucks is a stones throw away. Go there instead

Reviews.Author: Vi
Reviews.Content: Serenade is a very unique place! It's affordable and cute. The employees are super friendly & welcoming towards their customers.   I would say this is one of the perfect places to meet up with friends, family, etc.  just to hang out and have a good conversation! Compared to other places, this is one of my favorite places to study at. Personally, depending on where you sit, the lighting can be quite dim to study in.   They have great tea selections! I usually get the earl grey hot tea (refills allowed & you can request an extra cup). Their raspberry and mango macchiatos were really nice! There was a good mix of flavors, rather than having too much of the sweet syrup taste of raspberry or mango. Their honey toast and other pastries are quite delicious as well! :)  Note:  If it's during the cold seasons of the year, they also provide blankets for people who sit outside!

Reviews.Author: geo
Reviews.Content: I really like this place, the Spanish latte is delicious, music is a bit too loud for my taste but drinks are good

Reviews.Author: Destiny
Reviews.Content: A cute place for a coffee date. Didn't understand why they didn't have brewed coffee... in a coffee shop?  My cappuccino was good, but they only filled the cup up half way, but my friends was filled completely. Don't know if they didn't feel like steaming more milk or what it was.

Reviews.Author: Elbert
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! I come here all the time even thought I moved on the other side of town. It is so worth the drive knowing I am going to be drinking my favorite drink and eating the best honey toast in the city.

Reviews.Author: Janelle
Reviews.Content: The honey toast with icecream is amazing! The lattes, teas, and frappuccinos are delectable and flavorful.  I love the decor and feel of the shop as it gives a great atmosphere for study sessions, along with friendly hangouts. Also I'm glad it's open until 2 a.m. for when I have those late night cravings!

Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: So this is very disappointing...because apparently there's a time limit on the tables at serenade?... I ordered a drink at serenade and just like everyone else I began to study... soon after they decided that apparently I was no longer a customer and told me that  the tables are only for serenade customers  I was super confused... because I was here for an hour and half... yet people around me who were here longer than me were not asked to leave yet they didn't have a drink with them?!?!? (I knew there were people here longer because I had the Courtesy not to take up space while I waited for my friend SMH) I still can't believe they did this drinks were good... I guess new rule of serenade you have to BUY a NEW DRINK every 45 mins or you'll get KICKED OUT!! SMH!!! -ps- drinks are good tho

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Open late, good location, fair amount of seating, and a clean and simple space. Got a pot of tea and sat and enjoyed my laptop. Fun music, mostly Kpop from what I heard. Great place!

Reviews.Author: Mara
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place. The atmosphere reminds me of the adorable cafes in Seoul. Their green tea pat bingsoo is so yummy & the honey toast is to die for.

Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: I think with coffee shops, one factor to consider besides their drinks and food is the overall atmosphere and general set up.  For my drink of choice, I absolutely love their pistachio lattes. To me, it is creamy smooth hot drink with a subtle pistachio flavor. Just enough for the right amount of sweetness imo. Considering my sensitivity to caffeine, I am pleased to know that this drink does not (or has very minimal) caffiene. I could continue to have this drink and enjoy it as well.   As for the atmosphere, I really like the overall ambience of the shop. The lighting is softly dimmed but enough to suit those who are reading or doing any particular busy work. I also like the decor. The chalk menu adds character to this place as well as the drawings on the glass windows.

Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: When I walked in, I smiled at the barista/cashier. She did not return my smile, but something more along the lines of a friendly stare, I don't know. Eh, I figured she was shy.   I ordered a latte, and initiated some light banter, asking how long they've been in operation, etc...got a blunt answer, with no smile  Two Years.  Ok never mind, no points for hospitality. It was 11am on a Sunday, and they weren't by any means busy.  I received my latte, and she had made a Rosetta. I was delighted! Usually, latte art would indicate that the barista knows enough to properly pull a shot. However, their espresso had no dimension (maybe their choice of beans? Idk) my milk was also very overheated. Needless to say, I was quite disappointed.    I did not try any of their food, but I will not return for their coffee. If she was pleasant I might have chalked it up to an  off-day , and tried it again, but I have no desire to return to a place that will treat their customers the way that she did.

Reviews.Author: Rachelle
Reviews.Content: After hearing good things about Serenade, a friend and I finally had the chance to check it out. Right off the bat I could tell it was a popular spot. Lots of people chatting with friends and others with their laptops trying to study. There's an area outside with heat lamps to sit which I thought was cool. The decor was cute and trendy. I was excited to try the pistachio latte because I'm a sucker for all things pistachio. I also ordered a lemon raspberry cake because it looked yummy. Both were really delicious. I'm giving Serenade a 4/5 because the drink was pricey for its size. More seating would be nice but we did go on a Friday night so all the high schoolers are out and about. Other than that I would definitely come back to try other items.

Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: Open late, great drinks and dessert. What a gem in the southwest area. Everything order has turned out great except I had one dessert there that I didn't care for (i don't remember the name of it). But I won't knock off any points for that.

Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: First time today, definitely a good first impression. I ordered the honey toast because I guess that's what people usually get, and it was bigger than I thought it would be! I loved it. My friend ordered a pistachio frappucino and it was delicious! I don't like pistachio in general but something about that frappe that I love so much. I will definitely order their pistachio frappe next time I come here!

Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: This place is special. You know those coffee shops that you dream about? The perfect coffee, a cozy, warm atmosphere where people all around you are filling their brains with knowledge? Yep, that place can be found here!   The only thing they are missing is a perfectly cushy couch.   I came here and practiced hand lettering & calligraphy with a friend and they have plenty of space for people to sit and work.   I am going to be back soon with my hubby.

Reviews.Author: Sheryl
Reviews.Content: Ok, I went here 2 nights in a row cuz the first time I wasn't that impressed. I thought I'll give it a chance. The second night I knew I'll most likely not come back or maybe just order a to go drinks.  My first night here was ok. I thought the place was cute and cozy although a small group(3 ladies) was just a little loud like they own the place. But its ok they left soon. I ordered ice white mocha macchiato. It was good. I also had the macarons. Not going to order that again. Not worth the price i paid for.  The second night I went with my husband. We ordered ice cafe mocha which I really liked. We ordered coffee bingsoo. I'll give that 1 star. It was like a soup, unappetizing, not tasty. Also this time I decided we'll sit at their table outside. Wrong decision! It was so dirty. Napkins all over the floor. Drinks spilled, cigarette butts, floor was sticky. How can they just leave it like that? Im pretty sure theyve seen how dirty it was outside cuz they brought our order to us and another group. Please have someone make sure the outside sitting area are also clean. Not going back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: You like good coffee? Cool Atmosphere? Asian people? You will like this place. They are also open late for those of you who need the late night caffeine boost.:)

Reviews.Author: May
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful little coffee shop. You can get the lattes with the designs made in foam. There are wonderful little teas. This shop stays open much later than the typical coffee shops in the area (2am!!!) so you can go and get your late-night study on. The lemon cake was heavenly. The crowd consists of mostly Asian high school and college students. The staff is always friendly, soft-spoken and very knowledgeable of their menu. I don't believe there are really sizes so if you whether you want a cup of coffee or tea, it is all coming in just one size. I think that my little cup of tea costed slightly higher than norm considering it was just a cup of tea, but I suppose I was also paying for the atmosphere and a nice spot to chat with friends.

Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Walked in here tonight to grab a cup of tea and maybe some honey toast. It's a new place close to home so I wanted to check it out!   Me and my girlfriend walk in and the place is full of people sitting at tables enjoying their drinks and pastries but when I get to the cash register no one is around? I hear the jumbling of pans in the back so assume they are just finishing up something and will be right out. I patiently wait for 8-10 min still no one comes out? Sad I was craving something sweet and really wanted to give this place a shot. I think we will just wait for the new Sambalatte to open on jones and 215 always had great service there.  Maybe someday I will give this place another shot, please put a little bell by the register for customers to ring when people are in the back to know someone is waiting! Did I mention just by looking at the menu the prices are VERY high, almost to the point of being outrageous, I understand it's not a chain coffee shop but come on rethink your pricing to the clientele your catering to..

Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Great place to study or to hang out with friends. Highly recommend for college students

Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: Hands down best coffee shop!!! It looks like a scene from a korean drama!! Plus tofu hut is going to open next to it and gelatology..so far,they also have the tastiest coffee...love this place! Definitely our default chill place

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Stopped by for a treat after dinner. We had the Lavamour, white chocolate symphony, and the honey bread. Honestly, everything was SO GOOD! The Lavamour is piping hot chocolate cake topped with the yummiest vanilla ice cream and it comes with a tiny, tiny pitcher of milk to pour over the cake. Not sure if the milk added anything to the dessert overall though. The white chocolate symphony is a blended drink similar to the frappucino. The star was the honey bread for sure. Topped again with the amazing vanilla ice cream, the honey bread had amazing texture and flavor. The inner portion was so custardy and delicious.   The only drawback is the price. Very expensive.

Reviews.Author: Anne
