Reviews.Content: The pistachio latte is delicious. They only have one size available though. The baristas making my drink were nice but were in a deep conversation with each other in between taking my order. Must have been important....

Reviews.Author: Juan
Reviews.Content: Had no idea this joint was going to be like those Korean Drama cafe' settings, but whateves... It surely does give you that vibe. I feel as if this place should belong somewhere downtown, but I am glad its not cause it gives you a sense, or just me, that its ours. Like not a tourist, or franchise thing. Its a hell of a drive coming from Henderson though, if you take surface streets that is. All the drinks and snacks to munch on are nice looking. For some reason when I was there there was a lot of black and white going on. Meaning the customers  were matching the workers color scheme. Freaky huh? Guess I will match the next time Im there. haha.    Yeah, but the place has plenty of seating in and out, but more outside though. The wooden floors are nice so is the set up and the restroom.

Reviews.Author: Rothepaperplane
Reviews.Content: Open late night; great for when you have finals. If it's not too busy you can definitely do homework, or just chill. Friendly staff, limited items but all a

Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: So far I have had pistachio latte and raspberry macchiato.  Both have been consistently delicious!  The staff is always polite and efficient.

Reviews.Author: Cami
Reviews.Content: Serenade has an open ceiling design aiming for a loft-like ambiance. Menu is written with chalk in a blackboard behind the counter where to order. Free wifi connection if you plan to hang and chill. Ended up ordering their Buccaneer Tea and Maple Belgian Waffle. Tea was served in a clear glass teapot with a small candle, a teapot warmer attachment under it. It costs $7 but it was good to share for 2-3 people. The tea was pretty good and we were offered a refill after the server saw that the pot was almost empty. Nothing special about their cakes and waffles though. The Belgian waffle doesn't taste as good as it looks. I recommend trying their hot teas, cold teas on glass jars with a clever cork cover, and their honeytoast but not their cakes.  Over all, it's a 3.75

Reviews.Author: Belle
Reviews.Content: My new fave drink: Spanish latte!! My son loves their macarons.... And they're made the way they're supposed to be... Soft and chewy... Not hard and crusty with no flavor! (crown bakery =x)

Reviews.Author: GG
Reviews.Content: As Italian cuisinier, my love for coffee, particularly Espresso, is a very passionate one.   As a child, growing up in Sicily, I fell in love with the smell of coffee.  It was EVERYWHERE.  ALL Coffee bars, at the time, roasted their own beans, and I would get waft after waft of that beautiful aroma every morning whilst walking to school.  It wasn't until when, in my 20's, I went back as an adult to further my studies that I REALLY fell in love with coffee. My favorite came from this little bar in Busseto, the town Giuseppe Verdi, my favorite opera composer, was born.  OK, I'm telling you all this so you understand where I am coming from when I boldly proclaim: The barrista at Serenade made me one of the TOP TWO espressi of my life!  I cannot put one ahead of the other, because, as my father once taught me in my inquiry of who was a better tenor, Pavarotti or Domingo:  it's unfair to compare greatness to one another .  The espresso had great viscosity, creamy on the palate, AWESOME walnut shell color foam, beautifully portioned (about .75 oz), and a flavor that took me back to the land of my ancestry.  Rare when this happens.  Thank you for being around the corner from my house.  Get's expensive to fly to Busseto for a cup of espresso!

Reviews.Author: GieGie
Reviews.Content: Super nice atmosphere! Very ambient and chill. Would come here again! We ordered the Lavender Tea and it's soooo relaxing! It's a bit watered down but no big deal.  We also ordered the chicken pesto! It's delicious!!! Great place for dates. :)

Reviews.Author: Kosian
Reviews.Content: Great cafe', great location. This is is my first time here. It was surprising me that there a nice little place in a small plaza. We had a burry waffle and it was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Charity
Reviews.Content: This is EXACTLY what this area needed - a non-Starbucks coffee shop. Yay!!!   I heard about this place through Unlokt, a local app and website that introduces new and trending spots to their members.  Serenade is located next to Patty's closet on Rainbow and Windmill. The shop offers an indoor and outdoor seating area, which is great right now as the weather is still perfect and not quite freezing cold yet.    On my first visit I had an iced coffee, just to see what their coffee was like.  It was delicious!  Loved it.  They carry soy milk, no almond milk just yet but they did tell me that they are working on carrying it very soon.    My friend had a cup of Vanilla Chai which was absolutely amazing!  They were making some strawberry tea and offered us a sample to try.  It smelled amazing somehow, but it wasn't very tasty, but they were just sampling the product to see if they should bring it in.  No points lost there.  :)   My next visit I brought my daughter for dessert .  We ordered a pineapple juice and a lemon cream cake.  Everything was awesome!  We were very impressed with the dessert and I absolutely love their  juices.  Very impressive.    The only thing I will say in the negative is that their pricing is a little steep and something about their seating doesn't make you want to stay.  I think they can make it more inviting some how.  But other than that, it's great!   We will definitely be regulars here.  :)

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Pistachio Latte Garlic Honey Toast Honey Toast  With Las Vegas undergoing their independent coffee shop renaissance a few years after most major cities it is perhaps a testament to the local Asian cultures that one of the more well received new locations has been Serenade, a Korean Coffee locale situated in the Southwest featuring a well culled menu of drinks and lattes alongside a small pastry menu and particularly well regarded Honey Toast, the latter of which was to be the focus of an 8am Saturday morning visit along with the oft raved Pistachio Latte.  Small and stylish with free Wi-Fi and comfortable seating plus a soundtrack that is present but not invasive it was with some irritation that, true to rumor, our arrival was originally met with the restaurant claiming to be unable to make honey toast because they were 'out of bread' while also confirming that none of the pastries were made in-house but in true service recovery mode it was then with some surprise that upon hearing about our reasons for visiting a clerk was dispatched not only to retrieve bread but also to prepare two orders of the item for free - one traditional, one with garlic, and both topped with ice cream plus honey.  Admittedly impressed by such a showing of service though still a bit mystified as to how/why they would allow this issue to be recurrent I must say that overall the latte was serviceable albeit a bit cooler than I'd prefer while both of the honey toasts were quite good, the texture every bit on par with Ichiza and better than Spot while the quality of the bread and ice cream outstripped both.  Perhaps a bit too new to judge I cannot say yet that I'd rush back to Serenade given the distance from my home but at the same time I'd also not hesitate to recommend a visit provided Ray and team straighten out the bread situation as the garlic honey toast is definitely something that needs to be experienced to be appreciated.

Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I must say the customer service this time was much better, completely different staff and a whole lot friendlier. However they could still improve. I go and give it more chances because they are 1) local 2) unique menu items 3)delicious so I take it all with a grain of salt. This time I throughly enjoyed their Green Tea bingsoo $9 but rather large enough to share and some of their delicious macarons, unfortunately very pricey $1.99 a piece. I just wish they opened earlier, I would totally stop before work if they were.

Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: I was excited to try out this new cafe, especially since it's open late, close to home and offers something different than the usual Starbucks.  I had to go with the pistachio latte. I kept hearing about it and I haven't had anything like it before. I like pistachios, but I am usually wary when ordering pistachio flavored things because I find it can be overwhelming. This coffee was delicious. The nut flavor was subtle yet satisfying. The bf got an iced caramel latte. I tried it and it was tasty as well. I really enjoyed the flavor of the coffee, which was not covered up by the caramel.  I had to knock off a star for the price of the cheesecake. There were no clear prices posted for any of the pastries in the display. Our drink total was $9 and some change. But when I added the slice of ricotta cheesecake last minute, the total bumped up to $16-something. So that skinny sliver cost almost as much as 2 drinks? In my opinion, that's a little steep, especially for the small portion.  On the bright side, the cheesecake was good.  The place itself is clean and decorated nicely. It's warm and inviting. I can see students studying here. There's even, what looks like a stage in one of the corners. Future site of open mic nights maybe?  I will definitely be back to try out more of the menu, both food and drink.

Reviews.Author: Janice
Reviews.Content: This is a place I somehow find myself ending up at during late nights.   Everything I have ever tried here is just delicious. The pistachio bingsoo, the coffee bingsoo, the coffee drinks, and don't even get my started on the honey toast.  The first time I tried to honey toast here, I wanted to cry. I kid you not. It was an immediate blast to my childhood days when my grandfather would make for me buttered toast drizzled with a Chinese brand of chrysanthemum honey. Every single bite of the plain honey toast at Serenade was just perfect.   I love the atmosphere here. It's quiet, warm, and romantic lighting with soft Korean music playing in the background is so cozy. After leaving Serenade I feel more at peace with my life. Although I can't speak for what the atmosphere is like during the day, Serenade during late nights is an experience you won't forget.

Reviews.Author: Rachelle
Reviews.Content: I haven't had anything from here that I didn't like. Everything I've tried so far are really good! We've tried the Nutella Honey Toast, and it was really good! Not overly sweet. My fave drink so far is the Pistachio Latte (hot or cold). I also like the White Symphony but they can't make it hot. The Christmas Truffle is also really good! Idk how long they will have it. The staff are nice, and it's a cute coffee shop. Overall, everything is good!

Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: We had the pistachio latte, really nice. My new favorite drink! Comfortable, roomy place and friendly servers.

Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Nice cute neighborhood Korean coffee shop by my neck of the woods and it's open late.  Not to mention it's right next door to a poll dancing class. Hah.  There's about a dozen tables with a few out door tables to the side.  Coffee was strong just how i like.  And the honey toast blew Ichiza out of the park.   The honey toast was buttery.....it was toasty and crisp.....the ice cream melting in the inner breads mixed with honey.......i'm salivating just thinking about it.  We also got a complimentary Irish Cream pie.   Apparently they accidentally dropped the order of toast but the staff was so kind to inform us it would take 10 more minutes to whip up an order and offered the slice of pie.  We thought that was pretty awesome.    I'll be back to try their belgian waffles, other desserts, and array of coffees and other drinks.

Reviews.Author: Rowena
Reviews.Content: So glad this place opened up by us!  Always very friendly.  We go for their pistachio lattes and honey toast.  Thursday nights they have open mic, the one night we caught it the guy playing the guitar and singing was really good! It's cute inside too with the wooden table and lighting.

Reviews.Author: Janelle
Reviews.Content: Very chill place to enjoy a cup of coffee or tea. Love their honey toast, pistachio latte, and earl grey. Lots of people come here to study too, having late hours. They close at 2 am. There are usually just two people working so service can be a little slow if it's super busy.

Reviews.Author: Alexa
Reviews.Content: Serenade, hands down has the BEST honeytoast in Las Vegas. They have many toppings you can add, but I just stick to the original. Honeytoast has 4 solid walls of toast and on the inside is a warm, soft, fluffy, and delicious center. Then they put ice cream on top. Literal heaven. That's the only thing that I go for. The pistachio latte is also good. I always bring my out of own friends and family to enjoy it - and it's always a win. They are open late too.   The only downside about this place (even though I know it's meant to be more of an intimate setting) There's not many places to sit especially during a high volume time. Which is often. It would be great if they can provide more seating even on the outside.   Overall.. I go back because the honeytoast is just to die for.  Please go and try it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Whats good ya'll? Greetings! Top of the morning to you chap! Hola! Can I get your number guuuuuurl? Wanna get serenaded tonight guuuuuuurl? DTF (down to FUN of course)?  All opening lines to conversations you could be having at this quaint coffee shop in the bustling southwest of Las Vegas.  The pistachio latte is indeed the business, with probably zero caffeine but sweet and smooth pistachio  flavortown  is worth the $4 something. Coffees are around $3 and specialty drinks somewhere $4-$5. The food is on the expensive end, unless you enjoy the $9 waffles and $6 slices of cake.   Good for morning, afternoon, evening, and late night meetings with your study group, friends, significant other, business partner, or potential  client  ;).

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Serenade feels like a coffee shop straight out of a Korean drama. Everything is CUTE, ADORABLE, KAWAII. I wanted to take pictures of it all.  It's the perfect spot for a first date, solo studying, group studying or a friend date. I've been here multiple times and I always find more people studying/drinking coffee alone than those with friends. I LOVE that.  I've tried the matcha tea frappe, the chai tea frappe, and the honey toast; I recommend them all! The honey toast is a lot for one person, definitely share!

Reviews.Author: Lawrence
Reviews.Content: A very nice spot for college students to come and do homework while sipping on a hot latte or cold frap. The atmosphere is awesome and sitting out here on a summer night is relaxing . Free wifi so come here and stay awhile . I normally order the matcha green tea frap , it's refreshing.The macaroons are about 2$ but they have a deal if you buy a lot. They also have honey toast so come here with a group and you could share

Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: Pistachio latte lives up to the hype!  So delicious!  Could have been hotter but I won't complain since if it had been hotter I would have burned my entire mouth.  Waiting for it to cool down would have been impossible.  I also had a pistachio macaroon which was very good. The people working here were very polite and friendly while being totally unobtrusive.  I have a feeling I'll be spending a lot of time here :)

Reviews.Author: Teresa
Reviews.Content: Honey toast. Wow. A must try. My iced coffee was okay. My boyfriend thought his cappuccino  was good quality.  We really like the atmosphere. Here is our complaint, the music was horrible and way too loud. I couldn't tell if some of it was in English or really what kind of music it was. Sounded like foreign r&b. Terrible. We couldn't even read peacefully. Maybe it was because it was a slow Sunday afternoon. ?  Not sure. It's a bit of s drive as we live in green valley but We will be back. I need to try the pistachio latte everyone raves about!

Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: I got the two drinks that the staff recommended and both were great!! Looks like a great place to study.   Pistachio latte and Spanish latte were delicious. I highly rexommend it. I've never had a pistachio latte, it tasted like if nesquick made a pistachio powder. Its smooth and milky. A delicious liquid dessert.

Reviews.Author: E.
Reviews.Content: Any place serving food should be clean. As we entered there were finger prints and dust all over most of the windows. Now to the coffee--we asked for some favorites and the barista just looked at us like wha? Then he said pistachio latte. Well we settled on the pistachio latte and a caramel latte or macchiato. The latte was so bitter (I like authentic coffee) that I wanted to toss it. Cluttered shop, filth, poor attitude (service) and bad coffee  this is a NO!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Went here recently and was not a fan.  Pros: nice atmosphere, good location, great hours because it was open late. But that's about it.  Cons: overpriced, $6 for a 12oz Chai Latte seems a bit excessive to me, especially considering my cup was only filled 75% of the way. My friends cups weren't filled all the way either (as an ex barista, that wouldn't be acceptable at the Cafe I worked at) Also the service wasn't very friendly.  I only tried the Chai (which wasn't very good) so I can't make a proper review about the quality of their other drinks, or their food. But I don't think I'll be back, just because of how overpriced it was. I'll stick to Sunrise Coffee or Samba Latte.

Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: Cute place, fair coffee, fair food (not many options), and the bread desserts looked good. Turned off by how loud the music was. I had to holler like I was in a loud bar.. not my idea of a coffee shop environment. But there is outside seating. I'll go back to try the dessert bread perhaps on a nice evening to sit outside.

Reviews.Author: Josilynn
Reviews.Content: Happy that there is location near me that serves Honey Toast. Now I don't have to go all the way to China Town to get my fix. Btw... Ask for extra Honey.

Reviews.Author: Kameron
Reviews.Content: Honey toast is great! Macaroons are amazing I tried 6 of them! And if you get their hot teas get the pot its worth it!

Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: I ordered a coffee drink with almond milk and the guy proceeded to make it with regular milk until I mentioned it to him.  The place seemed messy and not as clean as when they first opened. The staff seemed confused like they had money to open up a coffee shop but didn't really know how to run it.

Reviews.Author: Jenna-Lynn
Reviews.Content: Honey toasttttttt and coffee!!!! I love the vibe and everything taste so gooodddddd!  The decor and the vibe is so chill and relaxing

Reviews.Author: Fwa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Coffee and Tea shoppe!! Open, Spacious and Clean. Outlets at every table and Wifi for long term visitors! Open late for the night owl and provides some of the tastiest tea in the Vegas area and a decent selection of coffee.. With daily specials, today being Ethiopian!   If you are feeling a bit peakish there are some lovely pastries.  And finally.. You can't have a good Coffee Shoppe without a wonderful staff! Everyone was friendly and patient with this out of towner :)

Reviews.Author: Marlon
Reviews.Content: Great place to hang out. The ambiance is like a rustic and modern cafe with Kpop music in the background. The drinks are a hit and miss. I had the Toffee Coffee Frappe, which was good but I'm biased when it comes to Toffee flavor items. The Lemon Creme cake was delicious and light even though I'm not crazy over Lemon flavor cakes. Overall it full of young people and college students with a bit of hipster vibe.

Reviews.Author: Trista
Reviews.Content: Not only did I have probably the best latte I have ever had, but the atmosphere and the customer service was phenominal.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Really cute cafe with plenty of seats (no couches though). I saw a a few people studying and others eating honey toast.   Simple menu with coffee, non coffee and frappe choices. Macarons buy 5 get 1 free. I was excited because I saw shaved ice, but we already got gelato at gelatology.  When we walked in there was a girl at the counter but she didn't say anything to us and just awkwardly stared at us as we looked at the menu. Eventually another girl came and she was nice. She recommended the Spanish latte saying that it's made with condensed milk and also a pistachio latte with a shot of espresso. We ended up getting those two drinks and a green tea latte.  The Spanish latte and green tea latte were warm...  There was actually no point in putting a sleeve over it since the cup wasn't hot. My friend said she couldn't taste the condensed milk in her Spanish latte. The green tea latte is powder based and that's exactly what it tasted like... Powder and milk. I went back and asked them to add in a shot of espresso ($1.08 extra). I was surprised it cost that much for an additional shot, other coffee places I've been to usually don't charge more than $0.50-$0.75. After that the green tea latte was MUCH better. The pistachio latte with a shot of espresso was the best thing out of the drinks we ordered because it was actually hot!   I won't be back for their drinks... I'll stick to samba latte instead, but I might want to try their honey toast.

Reviews.Author: Meghan
Reviews.Content: I went there to study. I ordered honey lemon ice tea first, it was so refreshing. Then I had chicken pesto sandwich, the bread was very crispy, and very tasty. It also came with salad. Later I had Pistachio soy latte with shot of expresso, loved it. Barista was very friendly, and served my food and drinks very fast. Favorite place to study and chill with friends.

Reviews.Author: Ms.
Reviews.Content: I love coming here... The coffee is ok (hence 4 stars). Its open late which is perfect for students like me. The clientele is asian based and they play LOTS of asian music. Personally, I don't mind. The lighting is on the dim side, it could be a bit brighter. Its always clean though and the workers friendly. The menu is not limited to coffee. I love how the hot teas are served (picture later) even if I  have not had one  but its easy to see that they are popular.

Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: Reminds me of the cafés I would frequent when I lived in Sydney.  Outdoor seating is available. Open late.  Plenty of people hanging out... Some on their laptops.  Order at the counter and they bring it to your seat. Honey toast... Soooo buttery, perfect drizzle of honey, generous amount of ice cream.  Just enough toast and not a single burn. Soft bread that just soaks up the ice cream as it melts. I'm craving it already!

Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Serenade is a new cafe in the southwest that has already become known for its pistachio latte (it is tasty), and is one of the few coffee shops open late in this part of town (original hours were 8:00am - 2:00am, but I overheard an employee saying that they may adjust their closing time to 12:00am).  Their menu has the typical spread of cafe beverages, from coffee to lattes to frappuccinos.  They also serve food, but it consists of dessert type foods: honey toast, waffles, pastries, cakes, etc.  Not exactly the kind of cafe you would start your day at by getting coffee and breakfast (unless you enjoy sugary breakfasts).  I've only had the drinks here, and I feel they tend to be on the expensive side.  Coffee is $3.00 and other specialty drinks are $4.00-$5.00.  Overall Serenade is a nice cafe that offers a charming setting to sit and relax, so I have no problem coming here on a fairly regular basis for a warm drink.

Reviews.Author: LaTisha
Reviews.Content: I have been here quite a bit and the coffee here is AMAZING! A cafe mocha will blow your socks off forget about starbucks. The honey bread is stupid delicious. The service is nothing special but the coffee and cozy environment is worth it. I wish they would open much earlier so I could enjoy that coffee on my way to work in the mornings. 11am for a coffee shop to open seems odd to me. If the opening  time and staff were better I would give the business a 5. The coffee and honey bread are definitely a 5 tho.

Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: I love this place; open late and perfect for any occassion.  It's a great place to work/study, meet friends, or have dessert.  The honey toast is really good and one of the better ones I've found in Vegas, but the teas and pistachio latte are what get me.  Most teas can come in a pot for sharing, with free refills!  BTW. What people are saying about this cafe is absolutely right: the scene is straight out of a Korean drama!  There's nothing wrong with that, but that just gives you an idea of its ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: Overpriced and lackluster in taste. The coffee isn't good and the honey brick toast is too expensive for the quantity. I tried their caffe latte, iced coffee and pistachio latte on several visits to make sure it wasn't an accident. It wasn't.  Don't fall for the hype. Not quite sure why people go here. It's frequented and staffed mainly by Koreans. If you want great coffee go to Sambalatte.

Reviews.Author: Tasha
Reviews.Content: Tried the pistachio frappe and bingsoo.. Honestly it's too sweet for me :/ Couldn't even get 1/4 finished.  Great service and atmosphere though!  Will probably try out the less sweeter items next time!

Reviews.Author: Danela
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to chill or work, whichever kind of person you are. Every time I'm here, I find my friend(s) and I leaving at around 1 or 2am. I think it's the warm tea served in nice tea sets that holds us from leaving.  Other than the tea, the k-cafe has decent desserts. First time visiting the place, I ate a cake. Can't remember what kind of cake so I'm gonna say it was generic and not memorable. Had honey toast another time, and not the best in town but good and great for sharing with ya buds. Last time I went, we got green tea bing soo. And I ate it UP. Great flavors and many textures for different experiences each bite.   A soft ambience and kind service. They don't forget about you (especially if you sit close to the counter. Huhu). We always get offered to have more water for our tea. Honestly tho, I only come here if it's brought up. I don't seem to remember about Serenade. But I still like it here! If you wanna catch up with an old friend, this is the place to visit! I'll bring my boo here next time.  It seems like a cute place to have a small date too.

Reviews.Author: Kiyoko
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here since Valentines day this year and since the first time, I've been coming almost weekly. Sometimes even twice a week! Its a local hang out my friends and I love to come by to hang out, eat, and talk for hours and hours.   We love to come for their honey toast and drinks. Currently I've tried at least 3/4 of the whole menu and love it! I have yet to try their displayed desserts and sandwiches but I still have more time to try out.   The whole layout of the cafe is super cute and reminds me of many Korean styled cafes from California, though I say they should add Macaroon icescream sandwiches and more drink types.   Overall I love the cafe and will keep coming here~  ((Extra bonus since they're open late!))

Reviews.Author: C.
Reviews.Content: 2 words: Honey Toast. I've tried it all except for the garlic but I bet that one is amazing too. I really love that this little cafe is quaint and open until 2am most nights. You can come here and do work on your laptop, etc. since they have space and good sized tables. The plum tea is SO delicious, especially during winter time.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I recommend going to this cafe. Nice cute and cozy place. Easy menu. Very well customer service.

Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: This place is nice!! The service was great. The White Symphony Frappe is delicious!!!! I had the the garlic honey bread as well and it came out nice and hot and was delicious as well. My sister ordered the raspberry machiatto and the Italian lemon cake both were fabulous!! I wish there was one closer to my house!! Will definitely be coming back!!

Reviews.Author: Alexandra Nichole
Reviews.Content: It's a Paris meets Korea coffee joint.   Pros:  - cozy feel  - the menu is unique and loaded with Korean pastries  - it's not too crowded  - clean and organized  - the pistachio latte  - free wifi  - they are so kind enough to bring out your order to your table  - their uniforms are so cute and professional   Cons: - there was little to no soap in the women's restroom :( - the restroom could use a renovation   Overall, hello new study/work station! See ya overly crowded Starbucks on 215 and eastern.

Reviews.Author: Kari
Reviews.Content: I've come to find that the cutest spots are often in unexpected places. Serenade is located in the Smith's strip mall, a couple doors down from Patty's Closet, and the signage looked like it was for a day spa, not a coffee shop, but I digress.  Onto the good stuff - I ordered the strawberry-ade which was delicious! There were little bits of strawberry pulp and the soda wasn't too sweet or too carbonated. The best part was the cute bottle it came in (I am a sucker for great packaging).  My hubby got the iced mango macchiato, which he enjoyed, but I didn't try.  Service was friendly and the environment was cool - there was a small stage in the corner, possibly for open mic night or some other entertainment (?). Great spot to grab dessert or meet a friend for coffee/tea/specialty soda.  The highlight of our visit was the honey toast. Toasted perfectly on the outside, warm on the inside. Sweet, but not overpowering, honey and creamy vanilla ice cream. Need I say more?

Reviews.Author: Edgar
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Its relaxed, casual atmosphere and tasty drinks and dessert will have me coming back for more. I've tried their white chocolate symphony drink (think blended frappucino style drink) and the mango latte. Both were delicious. The mango latte was a surprise as the bitterness of the coffee and the tartness of the mango complemented each other in an unexpected way. The star for me though was the honey toast. It's topped with a very natural tasting vanilla icecream which slowly melts into the center of the dessert leaving the center like a custard ... yum! The outer edges were a little too dry so ended up being not eaten.   Overall, this place is great. Can't wait to go back and try some more ...

Reviews.Author: Joyce-Leah
Reviews.Content: Their pistachio frappe is soooo delish! But because I went around 7pm, not a lot of desserts to choose....wish there was a Henderson location so that I could go all the time!

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times since my last review. Still like it a lot. Their drinks are great and baristas are super nice. I finally got the epoxy app so now I'm able to use the virtual stamp card!   Last time I was here, it was way too hot. It's just perfect today. They had their door open so there was a nice breeze coming in. They also have blankets near the register. I use them to put over my chair so that it's more comfy :)

Reviews.Author: Natasha
Reviews.Content: Just tried this place out the other night and am really happy! This coffee shop is exactly what our neighborhood needs vs. Another Starbucks. Customer service is really great. The staff is nice and approachable. They made a great recommendation on dessert. I got a the berry waffle and my friend got the lemon cake with the cheesecake middle layer. Both were great! But the lattes were even better. They even have hot tea that stays warm with little candle, like teavana! I will be coming back!

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Afternoon with my daughter who was feeling under the weather and decided some good hot tea would be a good remedy...of course a honey toast wouldn't hurt either :) The cool Asian hipster coffee bar is a nice change from our usual Starbucks stop. Plenty of seating with power strip along window tables and walls to encourage plug ins. A small dessert display with a few tempting treats left. Menu is hand written in chalk and prices are mom & pop shop prices... $7 for a pot of tea...hmmm this better be good. Be sure to download the Epoxy app, it works as a mobile stamp card. You get 1 free after 9. My daughter ordered a pot of hot Fiji tea. It is brought out to our table in a pretty glass pot with a tea light holder. Fragrant green tea with delicate notes of papaya and pineapple. Soothing warm comfort, but a bit extravagant at $7. I wanted something cold so I got the green SerenADE. It comes in a cute bottle with a cork cap and the most refreshing drink of green grapes. Why is this drink not on more menus?? It is like drinking summer in...so light and an  ahhh  in every sip! I would definitely get this over and over again. I can't wait to try the red SerenADE made with red grapes. The honey toast was a legendary Yelp favorite that had me drooling as soon as I saw the pictures. Heck yes we were trying it!! Fluffy bread, vanilla ice cream, honey, butter...these are 4 of my favorite things. It was good...really good. Toasted cube of bread with a buttery soft center and a big scoop of vanilla ice cream with the added gooey goodness of honey drizzled all over. Yes, this was a sugar overload but my sweet tooth took over and then all that was left was a small puddle of vanilla ice cream among scraps of bread. I think my daughter managed to get some lol. We came home and both sugar crashed. My wife got jealous we went without her, especially after seeing our pictures. So like the good wife I am, I will make the sacrifice and take her this weekend :)

Reviews.Author: Jerome
Reviews.Content: This place is so cute. It's a cool place to hang out or do some work. It wasn't loud when I went and that was around 8 on a Sunday. Pretty cool decor.  I got a pot of ZZZ tea. It had chamomile and lavender. It's good for making you sleepy for sure because after drinking half the pot of it, I literally just wanted to go to bed.   They also have desserts and other drinks. I want to go back again and try something new.   The service is great. The prices are reasonable. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: I love you serenade. Your mint hot chocolate and honey bread does something special to my insides.. Serenade, will you marry me?

Reviews.Author: Keoki
Reviews.Content: Korean Cafe open late and that serves honey toast and Pistachio Lattes with almond milk?!?! Doesn't get much better. The atmosphere is warm and quiet, aromas of fresh brewed coffee and sweet desserts. No matter what time of the day it is, what the weather outside is, this place is a great slice of heaven. Give yourself a 15 min break from life to come enjoy a great beverage and small sweet treat

Reviews.Author: Roxanne
Reviews.Content: Holy s**t. This place is absolutely amazing. This is my first time here and I just took my first few bites of the garlic honey bread.... Whoa. The most ingeniously soft, yet crispy little creation. Yummmmm!!   I'm also having a pistachio latte, and it's every bit as delicious as it sounds!!! Creamy, soothing, not overly sweet.  I can't wait to try everything on the menu!!!   And it's close to my house and open til 2am, what more could you want?   I'm going to go tip them more before I leave just for making my day :)  New fav :P
